- kaminario-dsvm-tempest-full-FC http://52.3.254.104/10/713710/2/check/kaminario-dsvm-tempest-full-FC/ec0145a : FAILURE in 1h 09m 55s'}, {'account_id': 18058, 'date': '2020-03-23 14:18:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

Hi hemma, thank you for this patch.

I tested this patch locally, and noted that it allows extending a volume beyond the max_vol_size of its volume type:

$ cinder type-show max5
$ cinder create --volume-type max5 --name v1 5
$ cinder extend v1 6
$ cinder list
+--------------------------------------+-----------+------+------+-------------+----------+-------------+
| ID                                   | Status    | Name | Size | Volume Type | Bootable | Attached to |
+--------------------------------------+-----------+------+------+-------------+----------+-------------+
| 9b643602-2bea-4652-91ae-ad606f2c05d7 | available | v1   | 6    | max5        | false    |             |
+--------------------------------------+-----------+------+------+-------------+----------+-------------+

Could you please add a validation for volume extend operation as well?'}, {'account_id': 18058, 'date': '2020-03-23 14:24:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

s/$ cinder type-show max5/$ cinder type-create max5 && cinder type-key max5 set provisioning:max_vol_size=5/'}, {'account_id': 5997, 'date': '2020-03-24 14:04:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow-1

commit_message:
Adds support for min/max volume size on vol_type

Allows support for setting a minimum and/or maximum vol size that
can be created in extra_specs for each volume_type. This allows
setting size restrictions on different "tiers" of storage.
If configured, the size restrictions will be checked at the API level
as part of volume creation or retype.

2 new volume type keys are supported for setting the minimum volume
size and maximum volume size for that type.
'provisioning:min_vol_size'
'provisioning:max_vol_size'

Implements: blueprint min-max-vol-size-by-vol-type

Change-Id: I222e778902a41e552e812896d7afd0516ee7fe68

commit_message:
Cleanup py27 support

This repo is now testing only with Python 3, so let's make
a few cleanups:
- Remove python 2.7 stanza from setup.py
- Remove obsolete sections from setup.cfg
- Cleanup doc/source/conf.py to remove now obsolete content.

Change-Id: Ib42c12dffafe11104db0a4688930a75c3465a296

commit_message:
Adding missing sgdisk utility

Certain deployment interfaces, like iscsi, in Ironic need the sgdisk
utility installed onto the conductor to manipulate partition
information. The responsible package is now installed

Change-Id: Iabbcb65b3253813ba3d01cd9a38d5984e867c4ae
Closes-Bug: #1871927

commit_message:
Revert "wheel-build : temporary pip with checksum output"

This reverts commit 8b3532c562ddd644de86e0f0929d0b2d88631cfe.

The change mentioned inline has been incoporated upstream with [1].  I
don't think we've managed to replicate the corrupt wheel situation
since.

[1] https://github.com/pypa/pip/commit/0dbab23df903926de71b8e2ce08359a378327ad1

Change-Id: I58fa0a53939207427f286584e91e1c59d4863992

commit_message:
Add networking-generic-switch support for Ironic integration

This patch implements support for the networking-generic-switch (NGS)
Neutron mechanism driver to facilitate VLAN-based network segmentation
in multi-tenant Ironic deployments.

Change-Id: I502196175f9d7d75ea37d3fbaa5e4a88a8e59859
Implements: networking-generic-switch mechanism driver

commit_message:
Revert "Remove the Virtuozzo Storage Driver"

The driver removal policy was relaxed in January 2020 [0] to allow
unsupported drivers to remain in-tree at the discretion of the Cinder
project team.  Thus this driver, which was marked unsupported in
Train and removed early in Ussuri, is being restored.  It remains
deprecated and subject to removal should its presence affect the
gate adversely.

[0] https://docs.openstack.org/cinder/latest/drivers-all-about.html#driver-removal

This reverts commit 3e3153059618a30b7cce816d69b8b6af832262f4.

Change-Id: Ie14cac2512d57c8bf206a853d4b51b9036f71f61
Partially-implements: bp restore-unsupported-drivers

commit_message:
Cleanup py27 support

This repo is now testing only with Python 3, so let's make
a few cleanups:
- Remove python 2.7 stanza from setup.py
- Remove obsolete sections from setup.cfg
- Cleanup doc/source/conf.py to remove now obsolete content.

Change-Id: I272ca3391f3ddae2306d8c8513c624e976b26191

commit_message:
Cleanup py27 support

Make a few cleanups:
- Remove obsolete sections from setup.cfg
- Update classifiers
- Update requirements, no need for python_version anymore
- Use newer openstackdocstheme version
- Remove install_command from tox.ini, the default is fine
- Remove py27 stanza from setup.py

Change-Id: I3f517a43fbc1689ac1627a0a7c802dd08a9e2630

commit_message:
Enable the use scheduler creating share from snapshot flag

This patch enables the use scheduler creating share from
snapshot flag in order to run properly the manila tempest tests.

Partially-implements: bp create-share-from-snapshot-in-another-pool-or-backend

Change-Id: I15311089c45be1574857d46caa073e89424e716d

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-11 01:17:46.000000000', 'message': 'Add test coverage of existing quota sets policies

Current tests do not have good test coverage of existing policies.
Either tests for policies do not exist or if they exist then they
do not cover the actual negative and positive testing.

For Example, if any policy with default rule as admin only then
test should verify:
- policy check pass with context having admin or server owner
- policy check fail with context having non-admin and not server owner

As discussed in policy-defaults-refresh, to change the policies
with new default roles and scope_type, we need to have the enough
testing coverage of existing policy behavior.

When we will add the scope_type in policies or new default roles,
then these test coverage will be extended to adopt the new changes
and also make sure we do not break the existing behavior.

This commit covers the testing coverage of existing quota sets policies.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

Change-Id: I5b692cc15d763d4ae4ce8dd1ad1e83a83e0ab434

commit_message:
Add test coverage of existing quota sets policies

Current tests do not have good test coverage of existing policies.
Either tests for policies do not exist or if they exist then they
do not cover the actual negative and positive testing.

For Example, if any policy with default rule as admin only then
test should verify:
- policy check pass with context having admin or server owner
- policy check fail with context having non-admin and not server owner

As discussed in policy-defaults-refresh, to change the policies
with new default roles and scope_type, we need to have the enough
testing coverage of existing policy behavior.

When we will add the scope_type in policies or new default roles,
then these test coverage will be extended to adopt the new changes
and also make sure we do not break the existing behavior.

This commit covers the testing coverage of existing quota sets policies.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

Change-Id: I5b692cc15d763d4ae4ce8dd1ad1e83a83e0ab434

Congratulations, you've proposed your first change in OpenDev.

Your submission will now be tested automatically by Zuul, our gatekeeper,
and reviewed by other friendly developers. They will give you feedback and
may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches often take days (and sometimes weeks) to get reviewed, so be
patient. Don't hesitate to ask for help, and answer questions about your
work promptly if you can. The more you get to know reviewers and get to be
known by them, the smoother the review and approval process will become. The
fastest way to accomplish this is by reviewing other proposed changes
yourself: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for participating in OpenDev, we look forward to seeing you
around.

thanks for the feedback! We only want this to affect CI. 

 > Hi! You're only modifying the development scripts, it won't affect
 > the actual production usage. I think you need to fix the code.
 > Please talk to Ilya Etingof, however, since he's been working on
 > related fixes.

Thanks for the feedback! We only want this to affect CI. Production will be handled through documentation."}, {'account_id': 26340, 'date': '2020-04-14 16:00:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)

Can you please provide any insight on what this bug is all about, how this workaround helps, when we expect this workaround to be removed?'}, {'account_id': 26340, 'date': '2020-04-14 16:05:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 10379, 'date': '2020-04-14 16:10:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Post a launchpad defect? 
https://launchpad.net/ironic

Add release note?

Is this dell hardware specific?'}, {'account_id': 10379, 'date': '2020-04-14 16:10:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1'}, {'account_id': 10250, 'date': '2020-04-14 17:25:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

Let's abandon this and just hack it in to our CI.  This change is only needed for Dell hardware, and is only needed for the current firmware release.  The bug that it works around will be fixed in the next firmware release.  I will submit a docs patch documenting this in the iDRAC driver."}, {'account_id': 31616, 'date': '2020-04-14 18:56:13.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

Thanks you all! Abandoning, will hack into Dell's CI instead"}]

commit_message:
Continuous Mode Bug Workaround for redfish

Temporary workaround for continous mode bug
where setting boot mode to PXE via redfish fails.
Sets force_persistent_boot_device to Never

Change-Id: I1fc3fde56cd094776d4b076f34964156a94543ac

commit_message:
Cleanup py27 support

This repo is now testing only with Python
3, so let's make
a few cleanups:
- Remove python 2.7 stanza from setup.py
- Remove obsolete sections from setup.cfg
- Cleanup doc/source/conf.py to remove noww
 obsolete content.

Change-Id: Ie2d4e75ba3f81445fe9bcaf46e39d5f4110b350e

commit_message:
Add test coverage for manage_existing API revert

New tests covers revert functionality for manage_existing API.
Tests added
1. revert ManageCastTask with volume status update check after rollback
2. revert EntryCreateTask with check DB entry is destroyed
3. revert EntryCreateTask with taskflow.Failure, no revert is expected

Partial-Bug:#1599140
Change-Id: I99df840bd7c8cd913d6045dd90871eb8894bbac8

[{'created': '2020-04-06 14:23:17.000000000', 'message': "Fix opensuse trusted certificates

There's a bug[1] with the combination of the p11-kit and
ca-certificates-mozilla packages available on the latest built
opensuse-15 node in nodepool (which has not been rebuilt for weeks due
to a separate issue[2]) which causes the standard CA bundle to not be
installed correctly and causes jobs that call to external HTTPS services
to fail. Upgrading both packages in sync fixes the issue.

[1] https://bugzilla.suse.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1154871
[2] http://bugzilla.suse.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1166139

Change-Id: Ia8fdfe12fd9089e178adcb2b5eec997eebada262
Needed-by: https://review.opendev.org/713566
(cherry picked from commit 497caf015729d451428d5b608853741689f153b3)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix opensuse trusted certificates

There's a bug[1] with the combination of the p11-kit and
ca-certificates-mozilla packages available on the latest built
opensuse-15 node in nodepool (which has not been rebuilt for weeks due
to a separate issue[2]) which causes the standard CA bundle to not be
installed correctly and causes jobs that call to external HTTPS services
to fail. Upgrading both packages in sync fixes the issue.

[1] https://bugzilla.suse.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1154871
[2] http://bugzilla.suse.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1166139

Change-Id: Ia8fdfe12fd9089e178adcb2b5eec997eebada262
Needed-by: https://review.opendev.org/713566
(cherry picked from commit 497caf015729d451428d5b608853741689f153b3)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-25 15:56:25.000000000', 'message': "Fix kolla-ansible stop with heterogeneous hosts

The 'kolla-ansible stop' command can be used to stop the services
running on hosts. However, if you run this command in an environment
with heterogeneous nodes (most real world scenarios have at least
control/compute), then it fails. This is because it only checks
whether a container is enabled, and not whether the host is in the
correct group. For example, it fails with nova-libvirt:

    No such container: nova_libvirt to stop.

This change fixes the issue by only attempting to stop containers on
hosts to which they are mapped.

Change-Id: Ibecac60d1417269bbe25a280996ca9de6e6d018f
Closes-Bug: #1868596
(cherry picked from commit 89df07e8efda2a284ce357ddd91011e9fc4c5060)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix kolla-ansible stop with heterogeneous hosts

The 'kolla-ansible stop' command can be used to stop the services
running on hosts. However, if you run this command in an environment
with heterogeneous nodes (most real world scenarios have at least
control/compute), then it fails. This is because it only checks
whether a container is enabled, and not whether the host is in the
correct group. For example, it fails with nova-libvirt:

    No such container: nova_libvirt to stop.

This change fixes the issue by only attempting to stop containers on
hosts to which they are mapped.

Change-Id: Ibecac60d1417269bbe25a280996ca9de6e6d018f
Closes-Bug: #1868596
(cherry picked from commit 89df07e8efda2a284ce357ddd91011e9fc4c5060)

commit_message:
Revert "Remove the Veritas Access Driver"

The driver removal policy was relaxed in January 2020 [0] to allow
unsupported drivers to remain in-tree at the discretion of the Cinder
project team.  Thus this driver, which was marked unsupported in
Train and removed early in Ussuri, is being restored.  It remains
deprecated and subject to removal should its presence affect the
gate adversely.

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-02-24 22:35:37.000000000', 'message': "[elasticsearch] Add migration for Kibana 6.x index

Elasticsearch 6.x dropped support for mapping types[1], which by default
the Kibana index used. This means that when deploying ELK 6.x, the
Kibana index must be migrated to the new schema to preserve dashboards
and visualizations. There is a process defined[2], which involves
creating a new index with the specified schema, then reindexing the old
index's data into the new index, then doing a rename/delete.

This adds support for that workflow via Ansible. It takes place after
the ES container is restarted after an upgrade, so there will be a
(short) period of time where the Kibana index is not migrated. During
this time, Kibana still loads, but presents the user with a status
screen informing that the index needs migration.

[1]:
https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/6.x/removal-of-types.html
[2]: https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/kibana/6.x/migrating-6.0-index.html

Implements: blueprint elasticsearch-kibana-version-upgrade
Change-Id: I4550629e2113f3da7f1cecfeab0d5fe0d899dae8

commit_message:
[elasticsearch] Add migration for Kibana 6.x index

Elasticsearch 6.x dropped support for mapping types[1], which by default
the Kibana index used. This means that when deploying ELK 6.x, the
Kibana index must be migrated to the new schema to preserve dashboards
and visualizations. There is a process defined[2], which involves
creating a new index with the specified schema, then reindexing the old
index's data into the new index, then doing a rename/delete.

This adds support for that workflow via Ansible. It takes place after
the ES container is restarted after an upgrade, so there will be a
(short) period of time where the Kibana index is not migrated. During
this time, Kibana still loads, but presents the user with a status
screen informing that the index needs migration.

[1]:
https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/6.x/removal-of-types.html
[2]: https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/kibana/6.x/migrating-6.0-index.html

Implements: blueprint elasticsearch-kibana-version-upgrade
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/709624
Change-Id: I4550629e2113f3da7f1cecfeab0d5fe0d899dae8

This adds some attributes for adjusting the thread counts for each wsgi
application. By default we use 10 threads, however for the api service, it needs
to be set to 1 due to this upstream issue [1]. In addition, increase the

commit_message:
Set threads=1 for api wsgi

This adds some attributes for adjusting the thread counts for each wsgi
application. By default we use 10 threads, however for the api service, it needs
to be set to 1 due to this upstream issue [1]. In addition, increase the
processes for the api service to 6 to account for the reduction in threads.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/nova/stein.html#known-issues

Change-Id: Iebf78d24c57a069eabced1bf35051cbae5014902

commit_message:
Update the auto-doc-plugin to support legacy file names

Not all roles are running molecule with the coverage playbook file name.
This change ensures that playbook processing is done using both potential
names.

Change-Id: I95b43c30848b637d303a8927b0865d34df3acb9f
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-09 07:19:42.000000000', 'message': 'Add test coverage of existing keypairs policies

Current tests do not have good test coverage of existing policies.
Either tests for policies do not exist or if they exist then they
do not cover the actual negative and positive testing.

For Example, if any policy with default rule as admin only then
test should verify:
- policy check pass with context having admin or server owner
- policy check fail with context having non-admin and not server owner

As discussed in policy-defaults-refresh, to change the policies
with new default roles and scope_type, we need to have the enough
testing coverage of existing policy behavior.

When we will add the scope_type in policies or new default roles,
then these test coverage will be extended to adopt the new changes
and also make sure we do not break the existing behavior.

This commit covers the testing coverage of existing keypairs policies.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

Change-Id: If1bc954d6fa33e5a1014be79f93fbf4d72c89c13

commit_message:
Add test coverage of existing keypairs policies

Current tests do not have good test coverage of existing policies.
Either tests for policies do not exist or if they exist then they
do not cover the actual negative and positive testing.

For Example, if any policy with default rule as admin only then
test should verify:
- policy check pass with context having admin or server owner
- policy check fail with context having non-admin and not server owner

As discussed in policy-defaults-refresh, to change the policies
with new default roles and scope_type, we need to have the enough
testing coverage of existing policy behavior.

When we will add the scope_type in policies or new default roles,
then these test coverage will be extended to adopt the new changes
and also make sure we do not break the existing behavior.

This commit covers the testing coverage of existing keypairs policies.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

Change-Id: If1bc954d6fa33e5a1014be79f93fbf4d72c89c13

commit_message:
Deprecate ironic::conductor::api_url

... because its actual parameter, [conductor]api_url, was deprecated
in ironic while ago[1], and will be replaced by
[service_catalog]endpoint_override.

[1] 308e414a57941675acf6cd825daafc653cf5927e

Change-Id: Ifde129eb4cf1487c41c4f015154dec316057ca8a

commit_message:
[ceph-osd] Move directry backed osd scripts under ceph-volume

This is to make ceph-volume as default deployment tool since nautilus
will not support ceph-disk.

Change-Id: I8c821e275d29d009066dfd1ddd577064354bf28f

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-03 13:56:33.000000000', 'message': 'Check tc_lib.add_tc_policy_class input parameters

All input rate parameters (ceil, burst and rate) are mandatory in
Pyroute "tc" class [1]. "tc_lib.add_tc_policy" should provide them.

max_kbps:
Now "max_kbps" is mandatory.

burst_kb:
In case this parameter does not exist, the library uses the method
previously defined in Neutron, consisting of asigning the 80% of
"max_kbps".

min_kbps:
In Pyroute2 [2], the value of "burst" depends on the "rate" value. If
the "rate" value is too small, the "burst" value will exceed the 2^32
limit defined in the iproute2 structure. In order to avoid the error
described in c#4 of the related bug, the method checks if the provided
"rate" value is greater than the minimum possible value. If not, the
minimum value is set and a warning message is logged.

[1]https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/fb2453c999f1757cc9085f4533bb2fd56d6b2245/neutron/privileged/agent/linux/tc_lib.py#L107-L108
[2]https://github.com/svinota/pyroute2/blob/943502a95cbbbac48218d2bde9d92af462682f96/pyroute2/netlink/rtnl/tcmsg/sched_htb.py#L88-L91

Change-Id: If60f4ea9793b0872e348a6319f2c24127e93f540
Related-Bug: #1826565
'}, {'created': '2020-03-04 10:34:19.000000000', 'message': 'Check tc_lib.add_tc_policy_class input parameters

All input rate parameters (ceil, burst and rate) are mandatory in
Pyroute "tc" class [1]. "tc_lib.add_tc_policy" should provide them.

max_kbps: Now "max_kbps" is mandatory.

burst_kb: In case this parameter does not exist, the library uses the
method previously defined in Neutron, consisting of asigning the 80%
of "max_kbps".

min_kbps: In Pyroute2 [2], the value of "burst" depends on the "rate"
value. If the "rate" value is too small, the "burst" value will exceed
the 2^32 limit defined in the iproute2 structure. In order to avoid
the error described in c#4 of the related bug, the method checks if
the provided "rate" value is greater than the minimum possible value.
If not, the minimum value is set and a warning message is logged.

[1]https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/fb2453c999f1757cc9085f4533bb2fd56d6b2245/neutron/privileged/agent/linux/tc_lib.py#L107-L108
[2]https://github.com/svinota/pyroute2/blob/943502a95cbbbac48218d2bde9d92af462682f96/pyroute2/netlink/rtnl/tcmsg/sched_htb.py#L88-L91

Change-Id: If60f4ea9793b0872e348a6319f2c24127e93f540

'}]
commit_message:
Check tc_lib.add_tc_policy_class input parameters

All input rate parameters (ceil, burst and rate) are mandatory in
Pyroute "tc" class [1]. "tc_lib.add_tc_policy" should provide them.

max_kbps: Now "max_kbps" is mandatory.

burst_kb: In case this parameter does not exist, the library uses the
method previously defined in Neutron, consisting of asigning the 80%
of "max_kbps".

min_kbps: In Pyroute2 [2], the value of "burst" depends on the "rate"
value. If the "rate" value is too small, the "burst" value will exceed
the 2^32 limit defined in the iproute2 structure. In order to avoid
the error described in c#4 of the related bug, the method checks if
the provided "rate" value is greater than the minimum possible value.
If not, the minimum value is set and a warning message is logged.

[1]https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/fb2453c999f1757cc9085f4533bb2fd56d6b2245/neutron/privileged/agent/linux/tc_lib.py#L107-L108
[2]https://github.com/svinota/pyroute2/blob/943502a95cbbbac48218d2bde9d92af462682f96/pyroute2/netlink/rtnl/tcmsg/sched_htb.py#L88-L91

Change-Id: If60f4ea9793b0872e348a6319f2c24127e93f540
Related-Bug: #1826565

commit_message:
Fix broken unit tests because of list in notification drivers

Because the value for oslo_messaging_notifications/driver is now
a list[1], we should expect that a list is set when multiple drivers
are given.

[1] c7b0cc82fac79b47c3dd9a625cbd5a1eb192ed00

Change-Id: Ie9239423fefbe53244ac47bc5534684792af2be2

commit_message:
Add revert to snapshot support in VxFlex OS driver

Add support for reverting to snapshot in VxFlex OS driver.

Implements: blueprint vxflexos-revert-to-snapshot
Change-Id: I0ddde05a6270e06e1aee7e1e3bd5de34cc25eb3b

[{'created': '2020-04-14 15:00:59.000000000', 'message': 'Fix broken unit tests because of list in notification drivers

Because the value for oslo_messaging_notifications/driver is now
a list[1], we should expect that a list is set when multiple drivers
are given.

[1] c7b0cc82fac79b47c3dd9a625cbd5a1eb192ed00

'}]
commit_message:
Fix broken unit tests because of list in notification drivers

Because the value for oslo_messaging_notifications/driver is now
a list[1], we should expect that a list is set when multiple drivers
are given.

[1] c7b0cc82fac79b47c3dd9a625cbd5a1eb192ed00

Change-Id: I2fbf613bdb32194e8862bc1eaaa0a7c76af01048

commit_message:
Improve `redfish` set-boot-device behaviour

Makes management interface of `redfish` hardware type not changing
current boot frequency if currently set one is the same as the
desired one. The goal is to avoid touching potentially faulty BMC
option whenever possible.

This should hopefully improve interoperability with Redfish BMCs.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/710751
Change-Id: I380cd3aae410e05a4519c3764140ced121bf7fe7
Story: 2007355
Task: 38937

subject: Fix broken unit tests because of list in notification drivers
messages:
[{'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2020-04-14 15:09:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2020-04-14 15:52:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

Optimally all this type of testing should just make it contains the oslo::messaging::notifications resource with proper parameters and not that the config option gets set that should be tested in puppet-oslo.

We can merge all these to get it fixed right away, you can push them through yourself since it's only testing"}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2020-04-14 16:02:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

Thank you, Tobias, for your feedback.

I agree that we shouldn't test the behavior of puppet-oslo in each modules, and at least we should avoid to test all parameter patterns to test some logics inside puppet-oslo.

I'll go ahead to merge curent fixes by myself, but I'll review current test codes and submit some update about them. (at least we can remove the tests currently failing, IMO)"}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-14 15:09:18.000000000', 'message': 'Fix broken unit tests because of list in notification drivers

Because the value for oslo_messaging_notifications/driver is now
a list[1], we should expect that a list is set when multiple drivers
are given.

[1] c7b0cc82fac79b47c3dd9a625cbd5a1eb192ed00

Change-Id: I74b9bdaeefee1ed3bbb836d3a45e20e5609f0a8b
'}]
commit_message:
Fix broken unit tests because of list in notification drivers

Because the value for oslo_messaging_notifications/driver is now
a list[1], we should expect that a list is set when multiple drivers
are given.

[1] c7b0cc82fac79b47c3dd9a625cbd5a1eb192ed00

Change-Id: I74b9bdaeefee1ed3bbb836d3a45e20e5609f0a8b

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number

Sem-Ver: feature

commit_message:
Update master for stable/ussuri

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/ussuri.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/ussuri.

Change-Id: Idef6f9776436462b1d7690bf06da0b4aaf6d67f5
Sem-Ver: feature

'}, {'created': '2020-03-10 05:16:32.000000000', 'message': 'Add support volume migration in VxFlex OS driver

commit_message:
Introduce scope_types in shelve server

oslo.policy introduced the scope_type feature which can
control the access level at system-level and project-level.
 - https://docs.openstack.org/oslo.policy/latest/user/usage.html#setting-scope
 - http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/keystone-specs/specs/keystone/queens/system-scope.html

Appropriate scope_type for nova case:
- https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/ussuri/approved/policy-defaults-refresh.html#scope

This commit introduce scope_type for shelve server API policies
as 'system' and 'project'.

Also adds the test case with scope_type enabled and verify we
pass and fail the policy check with expected context.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

Change-Id: I9ef012514c92d73294188340b0eb8cd63e29ef25

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-03 21:11:16.000000000', 'message': 'Wait before deleting trunk bridges for DPDK vhu

DPDK vhostuser mode (DPDK/vhu) means that when an instance is powered
off the port is deleted, and when an instance is powered on a port is
created.  This means a reboot is functionally a super fast
delete-then-create.  Neutron trunking mode in combination with DPDK/vhu
implements a trunk bridge for each tenant, and the ports for the
instances are created as subports of that bridge.  The standard way a
trunk bridge works is that when all the subports are deleted, a thread
is spawned to delete the trunk bridge, because that is an expensive and
time-consuming operation.  That means that if the port in question is
the only port on the trunk on that compute node, this happens:

1. The port is deleted
2. A thread is spawned to delete the trunk
3. The port is recreated

If the trunk is deleted after #3 happens then the instance has no
networking and is inaccessible; this is the scenario that was dealt with
in a previous change [1].  But there continue to be issues with errors
"RowNotFound: Cannot find Bridge with name=tbr-XXXXXXXX-X".  What is
happening in this case is that the trunk is being deleted in the middle
of the execution of #3, so that it stops existing in the middle of the
port creation logic but before the port is actually recreated.

Since this is a timing issue between two different threads it's
difficult to stamp out entirely, but I think the best way to do it is to
add a slight delay in the trunk deletion thread, just a second or two.
That will give the port time to come back online and avoid the trunk
deletion entirely.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/623275

Related-Bug: #1869244
Change-Id: I36a98fe5da85da1f3a0315dd1a470f062de6f38b
(cherry picked from commit e37722c0f5f0b746135200db6f654674dc0f6f12)
'}]
commit_message:
Wait before deleting trunk bridges for DPDK vhu

DPDK vhostuser mode (DPDK/vhu) means that when an instance is powered
off the port is deleted, and when an instance is powered on a port is
created.  This means a reboot is functionally a super fast
delete-then-create.  Neutron trunking mode in combination with DPDK/vhu
implements a trunk bridge for each tenant, and the ports for the
instances are created as subports of that bridge.  The standard way a
trunk bridge works is that when all the subports are deleted, a thread
is spawned to delete the trunk bridge, because that is an expensive and
time-consuming operation.  That means that if the port in question is
the only port on the trunk on that compute node, this happens:

1. The port is deleted
2. A thread is spawned to delete the trunk
3. The port is recreated

If the trunk is deleted after #3 happens then the instance has no
networking and is inaccessible; this is the scenario that was dealt with
in a previous change [1].  But there continue to be issues with errors
"RowNotFound: Cannot find Bridge with name=tbr-XXXXXXXX-X".  What is
happening in this case is that the trunk is being deleted in the middle
of the execution of #3, so that it stops existing in the middle of the
port creation logic but before the port is actually recreated.

Since this is a timing issue between two different threads it's
difficult to stamp out entirely, but I think the best way to do it is to
add a slight delay in the trunk deletion thread, just a second or two.
That will give the port time to come back online and avoid the trunk
deletion entirely.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/623275

Related-Bug: #1869244
Change-Id: I36a98fe5da85da1f3a0315dd1a470f062de6f38b
(cherry picked from commit e37722c0f5f0b746135200db6f654674dc0f6f12)

commit_message:
[Unity] Retype volume support

To support change volume type after its creation in Unity driver.

Change-Id: I0885c83a2bdfffd3bbba23310665e5dff74fe5dd

(2 comments)

Need vxflexOS CI result for the patch.
Do you need to do something special for volume delete and for cg delete? expect that volume does not have a replication pair before it can be deleted. Ditto for cg, cannot be in use by any replication pairs.'}, {'account_id': 31016, 'date': '2020-02-25 09:15:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

(2 comments)

> (2 comments)
 > 
 > Need vxflexOS CI result for the patch.
 > Do you need to do something special for volume delete and for cg
 > delete? expect that volume does not have a replication pair before
 > it can be deleted. Ditto for cg, cannot be in use by any
 > replication pairs.

CG is not deleted by driver. Storage administrator creates VxFlex OS CG and pass it's name to the driver.
During volume deletion we firstly delete volumes pair, only after that replicating volume and replicated volumes can be deleted."}, {'account_id': 31016, 'date': '2020-02-25 09:23:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

commit_message:
Add OpenStack volume replication v2.1 support in VxFlex OS driver

Volume replication support will be added in next VxFlex OS (v3.5.0) release.
Cinder driver for VxFlex OS supports volumes/snapshots with
replication enabled according to OpenStack volume replication specification.

Implements: blueprint vxflexos-replication-support
Change-Id: I3f2ec1ddf1867261253190953f7a65fff22c7404

commit_message:
Support for Keystone password_lock option

This feature was added in Keystone V3 API. Proposed patch adds support
to Horizon

Co-Authored-By: Ivan Kolodyazhny <e0ne@e0ne.info>
Closes-bug: #1766485
Change-Id: Ic20a58c76826d703b43fa6a2d77ae5f77dcda1f4

commit_message:
[ci] introduce generate-index-html role

+ move index pages for verification and task jobs under specific role.
  it makes these pages available no metter what is going at the node

Change-Id: I072b6762ec4e1fca91a0543fd3521d0804125f9d

commit_message:
Fix the functional test devstack job

From last couple of months, the functional devstack job was broken.
Fixed the devstack job so that functional tests are run on multi-node setup.

Change-Id: I16906c2fb4ff71f0b4ddc42010182a0203c75231

This helps when we try to backport to previous releases'}, {'account_id': 31016, 'date': '2020-02-12 08:59:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)

> (1 comment)
 > 
 > Ivan,
 > a few comments.
 > 1. I assume it is backwords compatible to previous version of
 > vxflexOS. Does it support 3.0.x and 2.6.x versions.
 > 2. Suggest you add documentation changes either in this patch or
 > separate patch. That should also include the change to
 > https://docs.openstack.org/cinder/latest/reference/support-matrix.html

1. Yes, it is backwords compatible with previous versions.
2. Documentation will be added later after this patch will be merged.'}, {'account_id': 31016, 'date': '2020-02-12 09:31:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(2 comments)

> (4 comments)
 > 
 > -1 for the DB access. But there are also a lot of unnecessary
 > changes from ' to ".
 > 
 > It would probably be better to break this out into two patches, one
 > to add support for 3.5, then another adding the replication
 > functionality.

Hi Sean, thanks for review.
1. Replacing ' to " I wanted to come to uniformity in driver code.
2. DB access
In VxFlex OS snapshots is volumes too. Replication is configured between volumes/snapshots in volumes pair. During a failover process we need to perform failover operation and update provider_id for each volume/snapshot to be able to perform operations on them later. 
In OpenStack snapshot is available after failover if it's volume was successfully failed over. And I did not find another solution for updating snapshot separately from volume except updating DB instance inside driver.
3. As for splitting patch in 2 parts you are suggesting to keep code changes (refactoring, rest_client) in this patch and move replication functions to another patch with the same topic. Am I right?'}, {'account_id': 31016, 'date': '2020-02-12 09:32:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> Agree with sean, we should split the patches
 > 1. For 3.5 support 2. Replication support
 > This helps when we try to backport to previous releases

Hi, Rajini.

 > Ping me in #openstack-cinder when you've answered so we can keep
 > this moving along.

Hi, Brian.
Thanks for review. All problems mentioned have been fixed."}, {'account_id': 31016, 'date': '2020-03-31 06:12:34.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from bp/vxflexos-revert-to-snapshot to bp/vxflexos-replication-support'}, {'account_id': 26537, 'date': '2020-03-31 06:59:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

commit_message:
Add support for VxFlex OS 3.5 to VxFlex OS driver

Driver code is prepared for future VxFlex OS 3.5 release.

Unit tests are fixed to work properly with updated driver.

Implements: blueprint vxflexos-replication-support
Change-Id: I693980384df22b2fa581d8715f73c69b0598dd59

commit_message:
Pass the actual target in server external events policy

Currently if target is not passed in context.can(),
it use defauls target which is context.user_id, context.project_id.
These defaults target are not useful as it pass the
context's user_id and project_id only which means we tell
oslo policy to verify the context data with context data.

This commit pass the actual target for server external events policies
which is empty dict because policy rule is system admin scoped.

Adding tests also to show that rule can be override with project
roles.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

Change-Id: Ia3e0d6a5b8cc5bc8d5c8209a62ffdc771bbf0fa9

commit_message:
Add new default roles in server external events policies

This adds new defaults roles in server external events
API policies. This policy is default to SYSTEM_ADMIN role.

Also add tests to simulates the future where we drop the deprecation
fall back in the policy by overriding the rules with a version where
there are no deprecated rule options. Operators can do the same by
adding overrides in their policy files that match the default but
stop the rule deprecation fallback from happening.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

Change-Id: I4ac2ca84edba09fc63a7822ac59746d99e63ddd0

commit_message:
Add auth_type to template context for openrc file rendering

We need to path auth_type value to the template because different
templates could be rendered for credentials and websso auth_type.

Closes-Bug: #1871806
Change-Id: If218813e0b4a8cc51c4e590081c5f3c50b35b8a7

commit_message:
Revise admin interoperable image import docs

This patch revises the documentation of the interoperable image import
feature available to admin operators to concisely describe Stein and
later releases.

Changes include:
- Remove enable_image_import option because it is no longer available
  since the release of Stein
- Simplify the language of the v1 API being deprecated

Change-Id: Ic155afd6de5b37a25743457e9a7ddd5a45dac4e8
Closes-Bug: #1808814

commit_message:
Fix broken unit tests because of list in notification drivers

Because the value for oslo_messaging_notifications/driver is now
a list[1], we should expect that a list is set when multiple drivers
are given.

commit_message:
Add new default roles in os-evacuate policies

This adds new defaults roles in os-evacuate API policies.
This policy is default to SYSTEM_ADMIN role.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

Change-Id: I829f45c4c5ee35fa8268a2c82106a08183e2f5b5

commit_message:
Add Python3 victoria unit tests

This is an automatically generated patch to ensure unit testing
is in place for all the of the tested runtimes for victoria.

See also the PTI in governance [1].

[1]: https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/project-testing-interface.html

Change-Id: I9282cffe860f11559a0a6a345e533c41f16bd0fe

commit_message:
Pass the actual target in server group policy

Currently if target is not passed in context.can(),
it use defauls target which is context.user_id, context.project_id.
These defaults target are not useful as it pass the
context's user_id and project_id only which means we tell
oslo policy to verify the context data with context data.

This commit pass the actual target for server group policies
which is server group project_id for show, delete policy and context
project_id for other policy.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

Change-Id: Ifdc0828e5989ccdca3bc9139960605c298b0053c

commit_message:
Pass the target in os-services APIs policy

Currently if target is not passed in context.can(),
it use defauls target which is context.user_id, context.project_id.
These defaults target are not useful as it pass the
context's user_id and project_id only which means we tell
oslo policy to verify the context data with context data.

This commit pass the actual target for os-services API policies
which is empty dict because policy rule is system scoped rather
than project, so the token scope check deals with the required
target checking.

blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

Change-Id: I575036854c0081e682bd2b7bceb5ed876d7a73c0

Add Python3 victoria unit tests

This is an automatically generated patch to ensure unit testing

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-05 04:30:17.000000000', 'message': 'Add test coverage of existing server topology policies

Current tests do not have good test coverage of existing policies.
Either tests for policies do not exist or if they exist then they
do not cover the actual negative and positive testing.

For Example, if any policy with default rule as admin only then
test should verify:
- policy check pass with context having admin or server owner
- policy check fail with context having non-admin and not server owner

As discussed in policy-defaults-refresh, to change the policies
with new default roles and scope_type, we need to have the enough
testing coverage of existing policy behavior.

When we will add the scope_type in policies or new default roles,
then these test coverage will be extended to adopt the new changes
and also make sure we do not break the existing behavior.

This commit covers the testing coverage of existing server topology
policies.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

Change-Id: I32aa5f20ee63966f50cc01349e0219495eed947c

commit_message:
Add test coverage of existing server topology policies

Current tests do not have good test coverage of existing policies.
Either tests for policies do not exist or if they exist then they
do not cover the actual negative and positive testing.

For Example, if any policy with default rule as admin only then
test should verify:
- policy check pass with context having admin or server owner
- policy check fail with context having non-admin and not server owner

As discussed in policy-defaults-refresh, to change the policies
with new default roles and scope_type, we need to have the enough
testing coverage of existing policy behavior.

When we will add the scope_type in policies or new default roles,
then these test coverage will be extended to adopt the new changes
and also make sure we do not break the existing behavior.

This commit covers the testing coverage of existing server topology
policies.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

Change-Id: I32aa5f20ee63966f50cc01349e0219495eed947c

commit_message:
Changing 'deployement time' by 'deploy time'

In addition to deployement being a typo, drawing from 'compile time' and
'runtime' expressions I think 'deploy time' is more appropriate than
'deployment time'.

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-02-16 20:16:08.000000000', 'message': 'WIP libvirt: Support attaching RBD volumes as host block devices

The os-brick RBD connector has long supported the attaching of RBD
volumes as block devices to a given compute host.

This change introduces support for this within the net Libvirt volume
driver, enabled using a new ``[libvirt]/rbd_block_device`` configurable.

For now the extend_volume method raises a NotImplemented error, in-line
with the underlying method in os-brick. Future work will be required to
both support this in os-brick and wire up the required calls in the
volume driver.

Change-Id: Ied3732042738a6194b635c55e0304d71a6fb66e3
'}, {'created': '2020-02-27 15:30:47.000000000', 'message': 'workarounds: Connect RBD volumes to the compute host as block devices

Building on the ``[workarounds]/disable_qemu_native_luksv1``
configurable introduced in Ia500eb614cf575ab846f64f4b69c9068274c8c1f
this change introduces another workaround configurable that when enabled
will connect RBD volumes to the compute host as block devices using
os-brick.

When used togther both options allow operators to workaround recently
discovered performance issues in the libgcrypt library used by QEMU when
natively decrypting LUKSv1 encrypted disks.

For now the extend_volume method raises a NotImplemented error in-line
with the underlying method in os-brick. Future work will be required to
both support this in os-brick and wire up the required calls in the
volume driver.

Change-Id: Ied3732042738a6194b635c55e0304d71a6fb66e3

commit_message:
workarounds: Add option to locally attach RBD volumes on compute hosts

Building on the ``[workarounds]/disable_native_luksv1``
configurable introduced in Ia500eb614cf575ab846f64f4b69c9068274c8c1f
this change introduces another workaround configurable that when enabled
will connect RBD volumes to the compute host as block devices using
os-brick.

When used togther both options allow operators to workaround recently
discovered performance issues in the libgcrypt library used by QEMU when
natively decrypting LUKSv1 encrypted disks.

For now the extend_volume method raises a NotImplemented error in-line
with the underlying method in os-brick. Future work will be required to
both support this in os-brick and wire up the required calls in the
volume driver.

This workaround is temporary and will be removed during the W release
once all impacted distributions have been able to update their versions
of the libgcrypt library.

Finally os-brick 3.0.1 is now required as it provides the
Id507109df80391699074773f4787f74507c4b882 fix when attempting to
diconnect locally attached RBD volumes.

Closes-Bug: #1869184
Change-Id: Ied3732042738a6194b635c55e0304d71a6fb66e3

commit_message:
Add new default roles in server topology policies

This adds new defaults roles in server topology API policies.
This policy is default to:
- PROJECT_READER_OR_SYSTEM_READER for get server topology
- SYSTEM_READER for get server topology with host info.

Also add tests to simulates the future where we drop the deprecation
fall back in the policy by overriding the rules with a version where
there are no deprecated rule options. Operators can do the same by
adding overrides in their policy files that match the default but
stop the rule deprecation fallback from happening.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

Change-Id: I9255a8108ef376bc36964c9d2966959a33d3251f

commit_message:
Introduce scope_types in server topology

oslo.policy introduced the scope_type feature which can
control the access level at system-level and project-level.
 - https://docs.openstack.org/oslo.policy/latest/user/usage.html#setting-scope
 - http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/keystone-specs/specs/keystone/queens/system-scope.html

Appropriate scope_type for nova case:
- https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/ussuri/approved/policy-defaults-refresh.html#scope

This commit introduce scope_type for server topology API policies as:
- 'system' and 'project' for get server topology
- 'system' for get server topology with host info.

Also adds the test case with scope_type enabled and verify we
pass and fail the policy check with expected context.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

Change-Id: I69e3c7f6073e8fd6d98aa7a3c7d65f3e2ea0dd86

commit_message:
Filter out auth_token_info from logging values

auth_token_info is a common field that subclasses of RequestContext
add. It contains things like the token itself and the entire catalog,
both of which are undesirable to log. The token is a security concern
and the catalog is huge, which bloats the logs an unacceptable amount.

This change removes the auth_token_info key from the logging dict
that we return to the log formatter, which eliminates both problems.

Change-Id: If5ebaa3c1859d32cd05f51defe173fc625b21af5
Closes-Bug: 1866705
(cherry picked from commit 1dd72d1d209e699efc360ff99a20166aac831939)
(cherry picked from commit ab17aef5735bcb242889f610d2165d46b380f7cc)

commit_message:
[NetApp] Fix vserver peer creation with same vserver

The NetApp cDOT driver is now fixed to ignore vserver peering
when creating and promoting shares replicas within the same
vserver.

Closes-Bug: #1872243
Change-Id: I0b82c15aec7862ee3630330805ac3ac177aae127

[{'created': '2020-04-03 21:44:44.000000000', 'message': 'Add a new config variable to identify ping command

This patch add a new config variable ping_check_cmd which
contains the correct path to the "ip" commands used by the
libvirt plugin. This is needed as the current code is
 expecting ping_check to be a "str" in some places and a
boolean in others. The easiest solution is to define a new
variable to hold the ping command and leave all other logic where it
expects it to be a boolean as is.

Story: 2007517

commit_message:
Remove incorrect assignment of ping_cmd to 'True'

This patch removes an incorrect setting ping_cmd to 'True'.
This is needed as the code is expecting ping_check to be
 a "str" and not a "boolean".

Change-Id: Id9978215cb11c3a0d8f756d8ff8a5e7f789170b4
Story: 2007517
Task: 39300

These methods are reaching the complexity limits, split them.
Also update messages to be more human-friendly.

commit_message:
Refactor AgentBase.heartbeat and process_next_step

These methods are reaching the complexity limits, split them.
Also update messages to be more human-friendly.

The complexity limit is returned back to 18 as before hacking 3.0.

Change-Id: I918af9508f3c99321625f6df96b1bf12ead26243
Story: #2006963

commit_message:
Cleanup py27 support

Make a few cleanups:
- Remove python 2.7 stanza from setup.py
- Add requires on python >= 3.6 to setup.cfg so that pypi and pip
  know about the requirement
- Remove obsolete sections from setup.cfg:
  * Wheel is not needed for python 3 only repo
  * Some other sections are obsolete
- Use sphinx-build everywhere
- Update classifiers
- Update requirements, no need for python_version anymore

Change-Id: I23a3b98e41099b74a4da95cc5c6e2d3171c0809c

commit_message:
Support charms providing templates with same basename

Replicate functionaltiy of ``charmhelpers.contrib.openstack``
where template files named after the absolute path of target
with path separators repalced by underscores can be used.

This convention is useful when charm author need to provide
templates with ambiguous basename.

Change-Id: I534fe52f38df7d1e409246115836223e90f080bc
Closes-Bug: #1872689

commit_message:
Update tripleo-repos to match pattern

This change updates tripleo-repos to work like the other roles in
tripleo-operator-ansible and expose all the cli options as direct
vars rather than hide them. This change maintains backwards
compatibility for the version/extra_repos vars but that usages should be
dropped by anyone consuming this role.

Change-Id: I00503563af0a6b8174169157d9da06a06f95ef0f

commit_message:
Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/ussuri

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/ussuri branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I80bed906b4045744dd0c231f034cc2ce88bb3e1a

commit_message:
Use placement stable version for functional job

nova-tox-functional is py2 job and need placement as required project.
and started failing for incompatible py version:

ERROR: Package 'openstack-placement' requires a different Python: 2.7.17 not in '>=3.6'

- https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/b460a8c59ad64e57b871aa3c00638b01/log/job-output.txt#782

Placement master is now py3 only which mean master version will stop
working on py2 env:
- I6f458fb60b5a33b5aa2ce3ab292862ab98eb4670

Current tox env mention the placement master link as deps, where need to use
the stable version for stable jobs. Making deps with version not the
fresh git clone like how other test-requirements.txt deps work.

Change-Id: I96bb9fcb55f2a4fc3aefa01db70b45740db166c8

commit_message:
Use python binary chosen by devstack

Without this patch, if python3 is not the default python in the devstack
environment, this command may use python2 and you may see this error:

    django import error - No module named core.management

This means that ./stack.sh will never run to completion.

Change-Id: Ie848088111dcb8b4cfe62c1b5302e8f6656216a6
Story: 2006976
Task: 37706

commit_message:
Add new default roles in server metadata policies

This adds new defaults roles in server metadata API policies
-to system admin or project member for create, update and delete.
- to system and project reader for get

Also add tests to simulates the future where we drop the deprecation
fall back in the policy by overriding the rules with a version where
there are no deprecated rule options. Operators can do the same by
adding overrides in their policy files that match the default but
stop the rule deprecation fallback from happening.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

Change-Id: I995e7fd115a8ef5bf8d459ea3028d4f4dfc851ad

@Rajat: I understand your point, but the spec does say the metadata will be put on a *new* volume created from a backup.  I could go either way on this, but since Xuan and Brin proposed this feature in response to a problem their users were having, I'm inclined to accept their approach as grounded in user experience."}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2020-03-18 15:59:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 23: Review-Priority+1

Increasing the priority as this implements a blueprint for Ussuri.  Would be good to have this in M-3.'}, {'account_id': 27615, 'date': '2020-03-18 16:43:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 23: -Code-Review

I just mentioned one of the few things i noticed during testing, let me list few more

- one case is
create a volume vol1
create a backup of vol1 say bak1
restore bak1 so a new volume is created vol2
backup vol2 to say bak2
restore bak2 to vol2
the src_backup_id of vol2 still has the id of bak1

- the name of the restored volume already suggests the backup id (restore_backup_<backup-id>) so this doesn't seem to provide any additional functionality except the preference of metadata over name

I'm removing my downvote if it satisfies the purpose this patch is trying to solve but still to me it doesn't seem to provide any additional functionality (or some dynamic changes i expected)"}, {'account_id': 21976, 'date': '2020-03-18 19:06:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 23:

> I just mentioned one of the few things i noticed during testing,
 > let me list few more
 > 
 > - one case is
 > create a volume vol1
 > create a backup of vol1 say bak1
 > restore bak1 so a new volume is created vol2
 > backup vol2 to say bak2
 > restore bak2 to vol2
 > the src_backup_id of vol2 still has the id of bak1
 > 
 > - the name of the restored volume already suggests the backup id
 > (restore_backup_<backup-id>) so this doesn't seem to provide any
 > additional functionality except the preference of metadata over
 > name
 > 
 > I'm removing my downvote if it satisfies the purpose this patch is
 > trying to solve but still to me it doesn't seem to provide any
 > additional functionality (or some dynamic changes i expected)

(2 comments)

Question inline about Rajat's original concern on PS23 (why are we not putting the src_backup_id in the volume metadata when we are restoring to the same volume from which the backup was created?).

Also, since the src_backup_id is in volume metadata, it can be modified by a user to have an incorrect value.  (That's ok, a user is allowed to remove or modify and volume metadata.)  My point is that we need to make sure that the code does not rely on the value that's in the src_backup_id metadata.  I'm pretty sure that your patch handles this case correctly, but I wanted to bring it to your attention so we are all thinking of that when writing/reviewing this code."}, {'account_id': 30092, 'date': '2020-04-02 15:42:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 31:

> (2 comments)
 > 
 > Question inline about Rajat's original concern on PS23 (why are we
 > not putting the src_backup_id in the volume metadata when we are
 > restoring to the same volume from which the backup was created?).
 > 
 > Also, since the src_backup_id is in volume metadata, it can be
 > modified by a user to have an incorrect value.  (That's ok, a user
 > is allowed to remove or modify and volume metadata.)  My point is
 > that we need to make sure that the code does not rely on the value
 > that's in the src_backup_id metadata.  I'm pretty sure that your
 > patch handles this case correctly, but I wanted to bring it to your
 > attention so we are all thinking of that when writing/reviewing
 > this code.

thanks， I will rename it to the old_src_backup_id"}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2020-04-02 15:42:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 31: -Code-Review

commit_message:
Add features for add backup id to volume metadata

This feature will support when the backup restore chooses
to create a new volume, record 'src_backup_id' in the
volume metadata.

Implements: blueprint add-volume-backup-id

Change-Id: I52b91bf8fba397f710e6915ed14f5c4d62729674

commit_message:
api: Allow custom traits

This was missed in change Ib64a1348cce1dca995746214616c4f33d9d664bd. We
also correct the allowed syntax for resource group and values.

Part of blueprint flavor-extra-spec-validators

Change-Id: I6a46556aaa1e7cab03286f92b716841759c63e3d
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/ussuri

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/ussuri branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Icde5163e169fba2831a024f6f3b8c39fc35cf44d

commit_message:
Update master for stable/ussuri

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/ussuri.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/ussuri.

Change-Id: I540a1fc2c509fff7cb92c34dc8fea50842252f5b
Sem-Ver: feature

It is? Surely there's planned work to resolve the performance issues in libgcrypt or switch to some other crypto library?"}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2020-03-19 23:14:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

On PS3 lyarwood said:

"As discussed I'd like to keep this around regardless of the libgcrypt issue being resolved.

IMHO the ability to disable our use of QEMU's native LUKS support is useful and could be required again in the future if issues with either QEMU or one of the supporting libs are discovered."

I took this to mean that this option is intended to be permanent. If it is, it should go under [libvirt], not [workarounds]. [workarounds] are things that are intended to be removed later. Is there something that I'm missing?'}, {'account_id': 10135, 'date': '2020-03-26 10:33:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Yeah that was my initial thought but given the overhead of turning this into a full feature I'd rather just keep it as a time boxed

commit_message:
workarounds: Add option to disable native LUKSv1 decryption by QEMU

Recently discovered performance issues with the libgcrypt library [1]
mean that operators may wish to avoid the now default native decryption
of LUKSv1 volumes as of I5a0de814f2868f1a4980a69b72b45ee829cedb94.

This change introduces a ``[workarounds]/disable_native_luksv1``
option to disable this native decryption by QEMU, allowing Nova to
fallback to the dm-crypt based os-brick encryptors.

This workaround is temporary and will be removed during the W release
once all impacted distributions have been able to update their
versions of the libgcrypt library.

The _is_luks_v1 method previously used to confirm if a LUKSv1 encryption
provider is being used has been renamed _allow_native_luksv1 and
repurposed to determine if native LUKSv1 decryption by QEMU is allowed.

[1] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1762765

Closes-Bug: #1869182
Change-Id: Ia500eb614cf575ab846f64f4b69c9068274c8c1f

commit_message:
Pass the actual target in keypairs policy

Currently if target is not passed in context.can(),
it use defauls target which is context.user_id, context.project_id.
These defaults target are not useful as it pass the
context's user_id and project_id only which means we tell
oslo policy to verify the context data with context data.

This commit pass the actual target for keypairs policies
which is user _id.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

Change-Id: Ia0b31a203e138e342f704d595e23af6d669844f1

commit_message:
Add new default roles in keypairs policies

This adds new defaults roles in keypairs API policies.
- SYSTEM_ADMIN, for create, delete keypairs
- SYSTEM_READER for GET keypairs

Also add tests to simulates the future where we drop the deprecation
fall back in the policy by overriding the rules with a version where
there are no deprecated rule options. Operators can do the same by
adding overrides in their policy files that match the default but
stop the rule deprecation fallback from happening.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

Change-Id: I90cbd4de22bbce1a7cbd0c5d3bb5ee0a27429dbc

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-10 20:02:06.000000000', 'message': 'Add test coverage of existing quota class policies

Current tests do not have good test coverage of existing policies.
Either tests for policies do not exist or if they exist then they
do not cover the actual negative and positive testing.

For Example, if any policy with default rule as admin only then
test should verify:
- policy check pass with context having admin or server owner
- policy check fail with context having non-admin and not server owner

As discussed in policy-defaults-refresh, to change the policies
with new default roles and scope_type, we need to have the enough
testing coverage of existing policy behavior.

When we will add the scope_type in policies or new default roles,
then these test coverage will be extended to adopt the new changes
and also make sure we do not break the existing behavior.

This commit covers the testing coverage of existing qupta class policies.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

Change-Id: Ide7391d822eed167e5ada77bacfbdda80edcadca
'}]
commit_message:
Add test coverage of existing quota class policies

Current tests do not have good test coverage of existing policies.
Either tests for policies do not exist or if they exist then they
do not cover the actual negative and positive testing.

For Example, if any policy with default rule as admin only then
test should verify:
- policy check pass with context having admin or server owner
- policy check fail with context having non-admin and not server owner

As discussed in policy-defaults-refresh, to change the policies
with new default roles and scope_type, we need to have the enough
testing coverage of existing policy behavior.

When we will add the scope_type in policies or new default roles,
then these test coverage will be extended to adopt the new changes
and also make sure we do not break the existing behavior.

This commit covers the testing coverage of existing qupta class policies.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

Change-Id: Ide7391d822eed167e5ada77bacfbdda80edcadca

[{'created': '2020-04-09 07:56:00.000000000', 'message': "Introduce scope_types in keypairs

control the access level at system-level and project-level.

commit_message:
Introduce scope_types in keypairs

oslo.policy introduced the scope_type feature which can
control the access level at system-level and project-level.
 - https://docs.openstack.org/oslo.policy/latest/user/usage.html#setting-scope
 - http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/keystone-specs/specs/keystone/queens/system-scope.html

Appropriate scope_type for nova case:
- https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/ussuri/approved/policy-defaults-refresh.html#scope

This commit introduce scope_type for keypairs API policies as 'system' and 'project'

Also adds the test case with scope_type enabled and verify we
pass and fail the policy check with expected context.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

Change-Id: Ia2c0b8b4869f1c5190036dadcea9b5e804aba9d6

subject: Fix live migration to use migration int. address
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-13 09:22:18.000000000', 'message': "Fix live migration to use migration int. address

In kolla ansible we typically configure services to communicate via IP
addresses rather than hostnames. One accidental exception to this was
live migration, which used the hostname of the destination even when
not required (i.e. TLS not being used for libvirt).

To make such hostnames work, k-a adds entries to /etc/hosts in the
bootstrap-servers command. Alternatively users may provide DNS.

One problem with using /etc/hosts is that, if a new compute host is
added to the cloud, or an IP address is changed, that will not be
reflected in the /etc/hosts file of other hosts. This would cause live
migration to the new host from an old host to fail, as the name cannot
be resolved.

The workaround for this was to update the /etc/hosts file (perhaps via
bootstrap-servers) on all hosts after adding new compute hosts. Then the
nova_libvirt container had to be restarted to pick up the change.

Similarly, if user has overridden the migration_interface, the used
hostname could point to a wrong address on which libvirt would not
listen.

This change adds the live_migration_inbound_addr option to nova.conf. If
TLS is not in use for libvirt, this will be set to the IP address of the
host on the migration network. If TLS is enabled for libvirt,
live_migration_inbound_addr will be set to migration_hostname, since
certificates will typically reference the hostname rather than the
host's IP. With libvirt TLS enabled, DNS is recommended to avoid the
/etc/hosts issue which is likely the case in production deployments.

Change-Id: I0201b46a9fbab21433a9f53685131aeb461543a8
Closes-Bug: #1729566
(cherry picked from commit 628c27ce9e693902c5cabedc7f254f2a1229a195)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix live migration to use migration int. address

In kolla ansible we typically configure services to communicate via IP
addresses rather than hostnames. One accidental exception to this was
live migration, which used the hostname of the destination even when
not required (i.e. TLS not being used for libvirt).

To make such hostnames work, k-a adds entries to /etc/hosts in the
bootstrap-servers command. Alternatively users may provide DNS.

One problem with using /etc/hosts is that, if a new compute host is
added to the cloud, or an IP address is changed, that will not be
reflected in the /etc/hosts file of other hosts. This would cause live
migration to the new host from an old host to fail, as the name cannot
be resolved.

The workaround for this was to update the /etc/hosts file (perhaps via
bootstrap-servers) on all hosts after adding new compute hosts. Then the
nova_libvirt container had to be restarted to pick up the change.

Similarly, if user has overridden the migration_interface, the used
hostname could point to a wrong address on which libvirt would not
listen.

This change adds the live_migration_inbound_addr option to nova.conf. If
TLS is not in use for libvirt, this will be set to the IP address of the
host on the migration network. If TLS is enabled for libvirt,
live_migration_inbound_addr will be set to migration_hostname, since
certificates will typically reference the hostname rather than the
host's IP. With libvirt TLS enabled, DNS is recommended to avoid the
/etc/hosts issue which is likely the case in production deployments.

Change-Id: I0201b46a9fbab21433a9f53685131aeb461543a8
Closes-Bug: #1729566
(cherry picked from commit 628c27ce9e693902c5cabedc7f254f2a1229a195)

commit_message:
Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/ussuri

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/ussuri branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I0e741ae1960cf4fd933044a63df6ceecd9fb3d72

commit_message:
Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/ussuri

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/ussuri branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Iba2f51817d2f3fd0ebe4f2eaeec9f5d3ca0f7f80

commit_message:
Cleanup py27 support

This repo is now testing only with Python 3, so let's make
a few cleanups:
- Remove obsolete sections from setup.cfg
- Update classifiers
- Use newer openstackdocstheme version
- Switch to hacking 3.0, fix problems found

Change-Id: I539b00204279c7645ef4a3f804f64a1e7af30f05

messages: [{'account_id': 841, 'date': '2020-03-29 03:54:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-03-29 20:14:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2020-04-14 12:33:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1\n\nAh, no lower-constraints job here :('}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-29 03:54:19.000000000', 'message': 'Update sphinx-testing requirements to >=1.0.1

During the investigaion of the mailing list thread [1],
it turns out that our test does work with sphinx-testing<1.0.1
and requires sphinx-testing==1.0.1.
read_text() method is from sphinx_testing.path.path class but
str is returned as app.outdir in test setUp() with sphinx-testing<1.0.1.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-March/013653.html

Change-Id: I35d6d4bed2e069a51794cc2a9baa8288869d894e
'}]
commit_message:
Update sphinx-testing requirements to >=1.0.1

During the investigaion of the mailing list thread [1],
it turns out that our test does work with sphinx-testing<1.0.1
and requires sphinx-testing==1.0.1.
read_text() method is from sphinx_testing.path.path class but
str is returned as app.outdir in test setUp() with sphinx-testing<1.0.1.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-March/013653.html

Change-Id: I35d6d4bed2e069a51794cc2a9baa8288869d894e

commit_message:
Ensure proper JSON in keystone bootstrap

This fixes the issue when keystone-manage output included
backslashes and/or double quotation marks which broke JSON string.

Change-Id: Ifae18c407210c12745d29fc4c95dca69aeafe6a8
Closes-bug: #1866017

commit_message:
Make oslo.tools more usable by newcomers

These changes make oslo.tools more user friendly by documenting tools
introducing commands shortcut etc...

Introduced changes:
- add doc and build it with tox
- add tox and shortcut commands
- centralize tools
- launch zuul jobs
- apply pep8
- apply bashate

Change-Id: I0f948c9f507b8c951c5748265699a2f515350ff9

commit_message:
Update master for stable/ussuri

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/ussuri.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/ussuri.

Change-Id: I5a742ab88b1d2ae6b594579f28b975ee6ec8ab2f
Sem-Ver: feature

commit_message:
Cleanup py27 support

This repo is now testing only with Python 3, so let's make
a few cleanups:
- Remove obsolete sections from setup.cfg
- Update classifiers
- Cleanup doc/source/conf.py to remove now obsolete content.
- Use newer openstackdocstheme version

Change-Id: I2c59ca525fa329b91720149cff3faee00fafff97

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-14 10:17:36.000000000', 'message': 'Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/ussuri

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/ussuri branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I11128848e17b13f1bb83651dc659c6d41632df95
'}]
commit_message:
Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/ussuri

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/ussuri branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I11128848e17b13f1bb83651dc659c6d41632df95

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC

OPENSTACK_KEYSTONE_DOMAIN_DROPDOWN - default value to "False"
OPENSTACK_KEYSTONE_DOMAIN_CHOICES - default value to "(('Default', 'Default'))"

The proposed solution is to add two variables in the horizon role (user_variables.yml):

horizon_keystone_domain_dropdown - defaults to "False"
horizon_keystone_domain_choices - defaults to "(('Default', 'Default'))"

commit_message:
Horizon configuration to support domains dropdown

An openstack-ansible deployment does not have options to set the local_settings.py params
for Horizon to support Keystone V3 multiple domains dropdown menu and its variants to choose.

These options in local_settings.py are:
OPENSTACK_KEYSTONE_DOMAIN_CHOICES - default value to "(('Default', 'Default'))"

Change-Id: I9f1b8e4c6f5b4fe2601e5ee1dacf90bded60f93d
Closes-Bug: 1795788

commit_message:
Make the display of none consistent in volume table

In volume table, when the value of 'description' and 'type' is None
there will display a '-'. But there display none when the value of
the attachment is none.
There should be the same style in the table, which is easier for
the user to accept.

Closes-Bug: #1743226
Change-Id: I5d9320957cfafba755dc8c979ffa3a638ecc37db

commit_message:
Move four jobs to experimental

This moves the federated monitoring, kafka, network
policy, and apparmor jobs to experimental to reduce
the number of jobs that run in checks these can be
unreliable and were non voting

Change-Id: Ic43efc5cdf2f7ff495eec01540189e7338f256ea

"Migration" plan can be considered later, but if you emphasize "insecure" I believe we should cover the migration plan in ***THIS RELEASE***. Is it feasible? In my understanding, we have this problem in several releases, so I am not sure how this is a serious problem. The migration strategy is still not clear as my hat of an operator. An upgrade notice should describe what needs to be done and how it affects to existing deployments. I believe openstack_dashboard/settings.py should set an appropriate default value. The Django default is JSONSerializer, but according to the bug report JSONSerializer does not work. It means horizon does not work with the shipped default.

commit_message:
Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/ussuri

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/ussuri branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Icaa3eb1c775c787de5c10007a70e44285ac686f9

commit_message:
Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/ussuri

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/ussuri branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I984360c69d23bcd9651a15f53bf97c2c45b58cd4

subject: Fix SyntaxWarning with Python 3.8
messages: [{'account_id': 935, 'date': '2020-03-31 15:23:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2020-03-31 15:40:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 5202, 'date': '2020-04-14 10:11:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1\n\nThanks James!'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-31 15:23:32.000000000', 'message': 'Fix SyntaxWarning with Python 3.8

Under Python 3.8, the following SyntaxWarning is logged on every
glanceclient invocation:

 SyntaxWarning: "is not" with a literal. Did you mean "!="?
  if kwargs.get('cacert', None) is not '':

Make use of '!=' rather than 'is not' to avoid this warning.

Change-Id: I11ed568932ec5ea0ffee629d6fd434433f262b67
'}]
commit_message:
Fix SyntaxWarning with Python 3.8

Under Python 3.8, the following SyntaxWarning is logged on every
glanceclient invocation:

 SyntaxWarning: "is not" with a literal. Did you mean "!="?
  if kwargs.get('cacert', None) is not '':

Make use of '!=' rather than 'is not' to avoid this warning.

Change-Id: I11ed568932ec5ea0ffee629d6fd434433f262b67
