subject: Fix latest_tag rendering for stable versions
messages: [{'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2020-04-13 13:48:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 16011, 'date': '2020-04-13 17:37:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2020-04-14 08:50:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-13 13:48:01.000000000', 'message': 'Fix latest_tag rendering for stable versions

Once role is checked out to the branch, pbr increments latest version
which results in not existing tag in the docs.
So we change the way of getting latest tag of the branch to

commit_message:
Fix latest_tag rendering for stable versions

Once role is checked out to the branch, pbr increments latest version
which results in not existing tag in the docs.
So we change the way of getting latest tag of the branch to
`git describe`

Change-Id: I6abb27b23290d04d639696b5821932db7da58546

commit_message:
Fix update of the deploy guide

Our deploy guide don't get updated and contain almost "static" tag
while OSA checkout as deploy-guide publishing gets updated
only when it's files are changed [1]
So we replace default template with our own, which is also triggered
when we bump roles in a-r-r.

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-zuul-jobs/src/branch/master/zuul.d/project-templates.yaml#L1389-L1395

Change-Id: I99e5c5698d2067709203c1a4e7e6b54f09dcbe34

subject: [elasticsearch] Update config for 6.x
messages:
[{'account_id': 29100, 'date': '2020-02-24 22:33:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 17669, 'date': '2020-02-25 11:52:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(3 comments)

Thanks Jason!'}, {'account_id': 167, 'date': '2020-02-25 16:20:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Why do we upgrade to ES 6.x and not to ES 7.x?'}, {'account_id': 29100, 'date': '2020-02-25 16:25:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> Why do we upgrade to ES 6.x and not to ES 7.x?

ES only supports a seamless transition of existing indices between major versions[1]. For this reason, I think we should only tackle one major version at a time. It is possible to support a migration from 5.x to 7.x, but it would require manually re-indexing everything.

I think we should instead just work to upgrade the ELK version as new versions are released and try to get them in each OpenStack release. Given that major releases happen only ever 2 years (current pace), that should be fine.

[1]: https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/6.7/reindex-upgrade.html'}, {'account_id': 17669, 'date': '2020-02-25 16:26:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

@Christian - unfortunately you can't migrate 5.x to 7.x without doing something exotic like spinning up a second cluster and ingesting the old one, or bringing up 6.x along the way. It was decided that this was too much to push onto users, and 7.x would come in the next cycle."}, {'account_id': 29100, 'date': '2020-02-25 16:28:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 167, 'date': '2020-02-25 16:30:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

@Doug: Thanks for the explanation. Then this is the more elegant solution.'}, {'account_id': 29100, 'date': '2020-02-25 16:33:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 17669, 'date': '2020-02-25 16:37:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-02-24 22:33:14.000000000', 'message': "[elasticsearch] Update config for 6.x

This updates the elasticsearch configuration file (and loading
mechanism) for ELK 6.x.

The default location for the configuration for all package
distributions is /etc/elasticsearch[1], so now that is where we
overwrite the elasticsearch.yml.

The path.conf and path.scripts paths are no longer supported and will
raise exceptions if utilized in 6.x.

The upgrade process has been updated to follow 6.x best practices. The
only difference is now ML jobs must be explicitly disabled and
re-enabled after ES finishes its restart. This will add some additional
latency to an upgrade run, as ES takes some time to restart (~30
seconds, I've found.)

[1]:
https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/6.x/settings.html#config-files-location

Implements: blueprint elasticsearch-kibana-version-upgrade
Change-Id: I4f74bfe07d4b7ca18953b11e767cf0bb94dfd67e

commit_message:
[elasticsearch] Update config for 6.x

This updates the elasticsearch configuration file (and loading
mechanism) for ELK 6.x.

The default location for the configuration for all package
distributions is /etc/elasticsearch[1], so now that is where we
overwrite the elasticsearch.yml.

The path.conf and path.scripts paths are no longer supported and will
raise exceptions if utilized in 6.x.

[1]:
https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/6.x/settings.html#config-files-location

Implements: blueprint elasticsearch-kibana-version-upgrade
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/647748/
Change-Id: I4f74bfe07d4b7ca18953b11e767cf0bb94dfd67e

I'm going to put a procedural -1 on this until Doug Szumski returns from paternity leave, since this will affect monasca."}, {'account_id': 17669, 'date': '2019-04-08 09:06:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

A few things here:

1. We need a supporting patch in Kolla-Ansible as this will break the deployment of Elasticsearch there. I have some work in progress patches I can push for this. See (https://github.com/RSE-Cambridge/kolla-ansible/pull/3/files, https://github.com/RSE-Cambridge/kolla-ansible/pull/4/files)
2. Logstash is only used by Monasca and is tied to the 2.4 release until the Monasca Kafka client is upgraded to support using a more recent Kafka messaging version. In other words I don't think we need to do anything about Logstash right now.
3. As Mark points out, we need to check that this is compatible with Monasca, in particular the ES upgrade. I still have a Monasca CI job on my todo list. I will report back soon."}, {'account_id': 24072, 'date': '2019-04-10 08:57:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: -Review-Priority

master is open again'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-04-12 15:37:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Could you add to the commit message:

Implements: blueprint elasticsearch-kibana-version-upgrade'}, {'account_id': 30523, 'date': '2019-11-19 08:22:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Patch Set 2 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 17669, 'date': '2019-11-19 11:02:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> Is there a reason for going with 6.5 and not 7.0?
 > 
 > Monasca has upgraded to 7.0 - I'm testing those changes now.

I agree with you that 7.x would be better. I haven't experienced an upgrade from 5.x to 7.x, so I doubt if there are risks that can break production environments. I'll test this case somehow."}, {'account_id': 17669, 'date': '2020-01-09 13:30:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

I will also do some testing as we will need to do this upgrade in a number of production environments. It seems that indexing from remote is one possible option [1], but would require a bit of work in KA.
https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/current/reindex-upgrade-remote.html'}, {'account_id': 17669, 'date': '2020-01-13 20:01:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

commit_message:
Upgrade Elasticsearch and Kibana to 6.x

Start using oss tagged binaries. These binaries contain only features
that are available under the Apache 2.0 license.

Implements: blueprint elasticsearch-kibana-version-upgrade

Co-authored-by: Dincer Celik <hello@dincercelik.com>
Change-Id: I8b52b2630a72393bf4b9c7095fc67db6c36c27fa

commit_message:
Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/ussuri

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/ussuri branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I09972f2a1a00cfa5118edf0718fc1aaecb62ea2d

commit_message:
Refer keystone_authtoken instead of neutron to detect region

... because we generally use parameters under keystone_authtoken
to find credentials.

Change-Id: I86b1a426e80f9bbaee62e10235a6491624b7d684

commit_message:
Allow ceph metal CI deployments

eth1 interface is not a valid interface for metal deployments.
br-mgmt interface should be used instead as a `monitor_interface`.

Change-Id: I8310c2485f2bfb9b283068d43c8acd35f29197c3
(cherry picked from commit 18a35faea121096b0f779929e689fa79ef4328b1)

commit_message:
Cleanup py27 support

This repo is now testing only with Python 3, so let's make
a few cleanups:
- Remove python 2.7 stanza from setup.py
- Add requires on python >= 3.6 to setup.cfg so that pypi and pip
  know about the requirement
- Remove obsolete sections from setup.cfg
- Update classifiers
- Update requirements, no need for python_version anymore
- Switch to using sphinx-build; fix build warnings
- Cleanup doc/source/conf.py to remove now obsolete content.
- Use newer openstackdocstheme version
- Raise oslo.utils version, 3.36.5 introduced uuidsentinel.

Change-Id: I8c81e0c1944c239e460befbf886993270902ee04

[{'created': '2019-04-29 15:34:39.000000000', 'message': "Revert iptables TCP checksum-fill code

To fix bug 1722584 we inserted a checksum-fill rule for
metadata proxy replies.  Recent kernels have disabled
this support for TCP because it was invalid, and
supposedly not doing anything, so let's get ahead of
things and remove the code.

Kernel mailing list discussion is at
https://lore.kernel.org/patchwork/patch/824819/

Partially reverts ed1c3b021751273e427d47fcf544c56bdabf97bb

Change-Id: Ib7cc8f82a91972f17987fb95130edc4069d9423f
Related-bug: #1722584
(cherry picked from commit b1b8a438fe3cdc422b8deb61548f47d383ee2fe8)
"}]
commit_message:
Revert iptables TCP checksum-fill code

To fix bug 1722584 we inserted a checksum-fill rule for
metadata proxy replies.  Recent kernels have disabled
this support for TCP because it was invalid, and
supposedly not doing anything, so let's get ahead of
things and remove the code.

Kernel mailing list discussion is at
https://lore.kernel.org/patchwork/patch/824819/

Partially reverts ed1c3b021751273e427d47fcf544c56bdabf97bb

Change-Id: Ib7cc8f82a91972f17987fb95130edc4069d9423f
Related-bug: #1722584
(cherry picked from commit b1b8a438fe3cdc422b8deb61548f47d383ee2fe8)

commit_message:
Remove HPE Lefthand Driver

The HPE Lefthand Driver was marked unsupported and was deprecated
during the Train release by commit 27c0ca65a26ab5476e0a732f5018e.
The product line has gone EOL and the LeftHand OS no longer receives
upgrades, so remove the driver.

Change-Id: Ibdd79282777b705c04b33073112f7280f45c2b2f

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-11 20:48:52.000000000', 'message': "Parallelize docs build

This makes sphinx-build use the number of cores available to make the
docs build parallel. On my 16 core system, this cut the time by ~50%. We
don't have as many cores available in the gate, but it should provide a
slight improvement in overall job time.

Change-Id: I7ad4d87a3dba10475a0fcf797a9aa2d4b1ad0eb5
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Parallelize docs build

This makes sphinx-build use the number of cores available to make the
docs build parallel. On my 16 core system, this cut the time by ~50%. We
don't have as many cores available in the gate, but it should provide a
slight improvement in overall job time.

Change-Id: I7ad4d87a3dba10475a0fcf797a9aa2d4b1ad0eb5
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Cleanup bindep packages

This file was copied over from the default set that used to be installed
for all nodes. Not all of these packages are needed for release repo
needs. This cleans them up to see what is actually needed.

Release magnum-ui 5.3.0

Includes required UI fixes to use let users
select Fedora CoreOS in cluster templates
and other smaller fixes.

$git log --oneline 5.2.1..origin/stable/train
2fd052e Merge "Add rolling upgrade ui" into stable/train
8bcf1d4 Merge "Add ui for resizing clusters" into stable/train
f6d2fa6 Merge "Imported Translations from Zanata" into stable/train
c3f04c0 Imported Translations from Zanata
b0fdeed Add rolling upgrade ui
d69b47d Add fedora-coreos distro
7bc8797 Add ui for resizing clusters

Change-Id: If99da6e8f4a5de5a65634fe66e18a47dbee494f8

commit_message:
Update master for stable/ussuri

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/ussuri.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/ussuri.

commit_message:
Cleanup py27 support

This repo is now testing only with Python 3, so let's make
a few cleanups:
- Remove python 2.7 stanza from setup.py
- Add requires on python >= 3.6 to setup.cfg so that pypi and pip
  know about the requirement
- Remove obsolete sections from setup.cfg
- Cleanup doc/source/conf.py to remove now obsolete content.

Change-Id: If6065686dd9250085a7582509becd92602cb1169

subject: Document image cache manager limitation
messages: [{'account_id': 8543, 'date': '2020-04-14 07:27:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8543, 'date': '2020-04-14 08:05:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 8543, 'date': '2020-04-14 08:50:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-14 07:27:01.000000000', 'message': "Document image cache manager limitation

When the compute hosts are using different CSVs, Nova must be
configured not to delete unused images since its image caching
mechanism can't properly track the image files in this case.

In particular, instances that were moved to other hosts won't be
tracked and their base images might be removed.

This is not a concern when not using shared storage or when using
a single shared folder (which might as well be a CSV).

Change-Id: If730f59473df576fd32eae5b930c60b1125d7ff1
"}, {'created': '2020-04-14 08:05:14.000000000', 'message': "Document image cache manager limitation

When the compute hosts are using different CSVs, Nova must be
configured not to delete unused images since its image caching
mechanism can't properly track the image files in this case.

In particular, instances that were moved to other hosts won't be
tracked and their base images might be removed.

This is not a concern when not using shared storage or when using
a single shared folder (which might as well be a CSV).

Change-Id: If730f59473df576fd32eae5b930c60b1125d7ff1
"}]
commit_message:
Document image cache manager limitation

When the compute hosts are using different CSVs, Nova must be
configured not to delete unused images since its image caching
mechanism can't properly track the image files in this case.

In particular, instances that were moved to other hosts won't be
tracked and their base images might be removed.

This is not a concern when not using shared storage or when using
a single shared folder (which might as well be a CSV).

Change-Id: If730f59473df576fd32eae5b930c60b1125d7ff1

commit_message:
Simplify setting deployment status

We don't use mistral anymore to set the deployment status.
This simplifies setting of the deployment status and also
removes the usage of DeploymentStatusAction.

Change-Id: I5454510dc3aae681d5b37570a15cf0d0c8a3a114

commit_message:
Set correct deployment_status in deployment stages

We need to set the deployment status before stack deployment
and for playbook failure after the stack deployment.

Change-Id: Ic353b6552d28d66bcc53a7a4df318e60de5bd320

subject: Fix broken Puppet::Provider::Glance
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-14 08:23:15.000000000', 'message': 'Fix broken Puppet::Provider::Glance

This patch fixes Puppet::Provider::Glance, broken because it still
depends on glance_store/os_region_name, which was removed[1].

[1] https://github.com/openstack/puppet-glance/commit/9e82f598ad86d99a5bc356ba5c118a52a1d5d9bc

Change-Id: I94111bd2b33053189d33faad43366424b1a68205
'}]
commit_message:
Fix broken Puppet::Provider::Glance

This patch fixes Puppet::Provider::Glance, broken because it still
depends on glance_store/os_region_name, which was removed[1].

[1] https://github.com/openstack/puppet-glance/commit/9e82f598ad86d99a5bc356ba5c118a52a1d5d9bc

Change-Id: I94111bd2b33053189d33faad43366424b1a68205

subject: Convert str to bytes for py3 socket compatibility
messages: [{'account_id': 24828, 'date': '2020-04-13 03:16:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2020-04-13 11:49:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 23851, 'date': '2020-04-14 08:13:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1\n\n(2 comments)'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-13 03:16:16.000000000', 'message': 'Convert str to bytes for py3 socket compatibility

socket.sendto() requires bytes and we need explicitly convert str to
bytes in py3.

Change-Id: Ib3f928963b11a2041caf1c3b15825125567ce360
Story: #2007537
Task: #39356
'}]
commit_message:
Convert str to bytes for py3 socket compatibility

socket.sendto() requires bytes and we need explicitly convert str to
bytes in py3.

Change-Id: Ib3f928963b11a2041caf1c3b15825125567ce360
Story: #2007537
Task: #39356

Add Python3 victoria unit tests

This is an automatically generated patch to ensure unit testing
is in place for all the of the tested runtimes for victoria.

See also the PTI in governance [1].

commit_message:
Add cinder_os_region_name parameters for cinder backend

This patch introduces cinder_os_region_name parameters for cinder
backend, because global os_region_name parameter was replaced by this
cinder specific parameters[1].

[1] 410747822c9433c83fd4aec547d3e4c288502f90

Change-Id: I4a7c9ac97ff2f1c04b651ecbc89b3cb1c583f2f9

commit_message:
PowerMax Driver - SRDF Replication Fixes

This submission addresses issues found in testing around suspending
and resuming replication on volumes in certain scenarios.

Change-Id: Ia0152f863d8a10e50a3d20e4d52dafe41995f033

commit_message:
Remove PE requirement from metadata.json

The PE requirement in metadata.json is not
supported anymore and puppet-lint will throw:

The 'pe' requirement is no longer supported by the Forge.

Change-Id: Ia6e420d3f3457407da7bcf4d52214dbf04a96c32
(cherry picked from commit 2262e9817a33fed188ab239e6bf0916482ace5a0)
(cherry picked from commit 325da049e953d3c031d43e796671a73e8b5f055c)

[{'created': '2019-12-31 14:33:52.000000000', 'message': 'virt: Provide block_device_info during rescue

This change adds block_device_info as an argument to the rescue method
signature for all virt divers currently implementing instance rescue.
This will allow future changes to provide all disks during a stable
device rescue attempt.

Change-Id: I9c2d9013d741774e521021913ec04f37b310e9d4

'}, {'created': '2020-01-16 15:35:45.000000000', 'message': 'virt: Provide block_device_info during rescue

signature for all virt divers currently implementing instance rescue.

commit_message:
virt: Provide block_device_info during rescue

This change adds block_device_info as an argument to the rescue method
signature for all virt divers currently implementing instance rescue.
This will allow future changes to provide all disks during a stable
device rescue attempt.

Change-Id: I9c2d9013d741774e521021913ec04f37b310e9d4

commit_message:
Support iproute2 4.15 in l3_tc_lib

In version 4.15 of iproute2 there was added support
for chain index in tc_filter [1].
Such version is available e.g. in Ubuntu 18.04 and it
has to be supported in l3_tc_lib regex to match
properly output of "tc filter" command.

[1] https://lwn.net/Articles/745643/

Closes-bug: #1809497
Change-Id: Id4066b5cff933ccd0dd3c751bf67b5d58af662d1

commit_message:
Add Octavia OVN Provider configuration (2 of 2)

This patch enhances Octavia's OVN driver config, so it can connect to
OVN_Northbound DB using TLS.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/714916/

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-11-07 11:09:49.000000000', 'message': 'WIP Messaging notifications should be set as a list

We currently join the list into a comma-separated string.
This does not make a lot of sense because oslo messaging
notification drivers must not be passed in the driver=foo,bar form
but in the driver=foo\ndriver=bar form. See:

- https://docs.openstack.org/oslo.config/queens/configuration/format.html

multi valued (MultiStrOpt)

    A multi-valued option is a string value and can be given more than once, all values will be used.

    # Driver or drivers to handle sending notifications. (multi valued)
    notification_driver = nova.openstack.common.notifier.rpc_notifier
    notification_driver = ceilometer.compute.nova_notifier

By simply passing down the list we let all the puppet backends
that use the openstack_config:ruby backend to work correctly
(https://github.com/openstack/puppet-openstacklib#defined-provider-for-openstack_config-ruby)

This will fix the scenario where multiple notification drivers are
specified which is currently broken and will let the single driver
scenario to keep working as is.

WIP as I need to still test a couple of scenarios

Change-Id: If65946412b42e0919456ed92fdd8e3788ad67872
Related-Bug: #1851629

commit_message:
Messaging notifications should be set as a list

We currently join the list into a comma-separated string.
This does not make a lot of sense because oslo messaging
notification drivers must not be passed in the driver=foo,bar form
but in the driver=foo\ndriver=bar form. See:

- https://docs.openstack.org/oslo.config/queens/configuration/format.html

multi valued (MultiStrOpt)

    A multi-valued option is a string value and can be given more than once, all values will be used.

    # Driver or drivers to handle sending notifications. (multi valued)
    notification_driver = nova.openstack.common.notifier.rpc_notifier
    notification_driver = ceilometer.compute.nova_notifier

By simply passing down the list we let all the puppet backends
that use the openstack_config:ruby backend to work correctly
(https://github.com/openstack/puppet-openstacklib#defined-provider-for-openstack_config-ruby)

This will fix the scenario where multiple notification drivers are
specified which is currently broken and will let the single driver
scenario to keep working as is.

Change-Id: If65946412b42e0919456ed92fdd8e3788ad67872
Related-Bug: #1851629

Need to think about whether this entire deliverable file should just be removed, since it sounds like technically, tripleo-ansible was not really part of the stein coordinated release if there wasn't actually anything there."}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2020-04-09 13:31:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 9592, 'date': '2020-04-09 20:18:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2020-04-10 12:12:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-04-11 20:20:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

I think we may want to just remove this file, but we can at least unblock the stable branch cleanup with this.'}, {'account_id': 13861, 'date': '2020-04-13 05:08:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I see stable/stein still exist https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ansible/branches/ ? any manual step needed for the cleanup?'}, {'account_id': 13861, 'date': '2020-04-14 06:45:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> > I think we may want to just remove this file, but we can at least
 > > unblock the stable branch cleanup with this.
 >

 > ? any manual step needed for the cleanup?

For record it needed manual step from infra after acknoledgement for project PTL or liaison.
https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/CrossProjectLiaisons#Infra or https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/projects/tripleo.html

<fungi> #status log deleted stable/stein branch formerly at 0eb5127abc8e9275c8b6f1b2c5ac735b936cc001 from openstack/tripleo-ansible per EmilienM'}]

commit_message:
Remove stein from tripleo-ansible in scope of removing stein branch

We need to remove stein branch for tripleo-ansible, so remove it
from deliverables before removing in infra

Change-Id: Ibff357be102c19c944b7e3f519b7ad542113c095

[{'created': '2020-04-10 19:51:58.000000000', 'message': "nova-compute: disable scale_tasks when docker is used

These tasks are only working & tested on Podman; let's skip them if
Docker is still enabled.

Change-Id: I87a2e83beadfce3b5078c2f75c6f1bfcc3d457cd
(cherry picked from commit 35ca5b43845db924c9dd554eb0c30bfbd135cd5b)
"}]
commit_message:
nova-compute: disable scale_tasks when docker is used

These tasks are only working & tested on Podman; let's skip them if
Docker is still enabled.

Change-Id: I87a2e83beadfce3b5078c2f75c6f1bfcc3d457cd
(cherry picked from commit 35ca5b43845db924c9dd554eb0c30bfbd135cd5b)

subject: Change horizon test runner to pytest
messages:
[{'account_id': 28032, 'date': '2020-03-04 10:21:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 28032, 'date': '2020-03-04 15:57:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2020-03-04 16:08:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

week -1.

Could you explain why pytest (with pytest-django) is super great than django testing framework?
How is pytest-django maintained constantly?
How long is it maintained confidently?

We experienced a third-party testing framework supports were dropped suddenly, so I believe we should depend on a testing framework which is supported as long as Django is maintained. At least the horizon team has no bandwidth to support such framework after the maintenance team has gone, and in such case we will hit another cost. This kind of questions need to be answered before merging it.'}, {'account_id': 28032, 'date': '2020-03-04 16:25:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 28032, 'date': '2020-03-04 16:40:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

pytest allows us easy exporting to xml (and html with a help of pytest-html plugin). 
pytest-django first release was in 2012. Now they are on 3.8.0 release.

pytest framework is currently one of the most popular testing framework on python ( thanks a lot to its plugins) and it's not going to be dropped suddenly."}, {'account_id': 28032, 'date': '2020-03-04 16:44:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

pytest is used by gunicorn, scipy, Pillow, celery, request, pandas, numpu, urllib3, aiohttp etc. pytest-django is used by Django Rest Framework, so I think pytest and pytest-django are pretty stable.'}, {'account_id': 28032, 'date': '2020-03-04 16:47:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2020-03-04 20:55:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 28032, 'date': '2020-03-04 21:03:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Since we are going to change only the runner for horizon, nor it's plugin runners or test structure, we won't affect plugins, that are running tests on their own, neither we will affect their inheritance from horizon test cases, since we don't change code structure.

About tags. horizon plugins can still use tags (since they do use django test runner)"}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2020-03-04 21:16:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

However, horizon plugin integration tests assume openstack_dashboard.test.integration.helpers.TestCase defines "integration" tag. Thus, I said your change affect horizon plugin tests.
it means you need to add the corresponding tags in all affected horizon plugins before merging this change. A change in horizon should not affect plugins including how tests behave.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2020-03-04 21:21:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

I am not against the change itself. I just point out how we avoid affecting horizon plugin testing.'}, {'account_id': 1736, 'date': '2020-03-05 08:36:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

"I said your change affect horizon plugin tests.
it means you need to add the corresponding tags in all affected horizon plugins before merging this change. A change in horizon should not affect plugins including how tests behave."

It's a good point, Akihiro. We have to care about plugins too. From another perspective, xml/html reports could be extremely useful for some automation for vendors. 

Probably, the best way is to have horizon settings path configurable, so you can pass the required value to tox. e.g. tox -e py37 -- settings='my.custom.horizon.settings''}, {'account_id': 1736, 'date': '2020-03-05 08:38:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

UPD to my previous comment. We've got DJANGO_SETTINGS_MODULE environment variable configured only for pep8 env. We should pass it everywhere we need horizon settings defined"}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2020-03-05 21:03:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> From another perspective, xml/html reports could be extremely useful for some automation for vendors.

Yeah, this would be helpful. Most OpenStack projects other than horizon have HTML reports from subunit, but horizon does not :(

> > Probably, the best way is to have horizon settings path configurable, so you can pass the required value to tox. e.g. tox -e py37 -- settings='my.custom.horizon.settings'

Passing Django settings file via tox posargs is not straight-forward.
As of now, tox posargs is used to specify which tests should be run.
For example, tox -e py37 -- openstack_auth, tox -e py37 -- openstack_dashboard.test.unit.api.
Thus the first idea requires more logic to parse posargs.

> UPD to my previous comment. We've got DJANGO_SETTINGS_MODULE environment variable configured only for pep8 env. We should pass it everywhere we need horizon settings defined

I like the idea to use DJANGO_SETTINGS_MODULE envvar.
In case of tox envs other than pep8, all tests are invoked via manage.py and manage.py set the default envvar [1].
In my understanding, this commit calls pytest directly and no longer use manage.py, so you need to pass DJANGO_SETTINGS_MODULE directly.

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/src/branch/master/manage.py#L21-L22"}, {'account_id': 28032, 'date': '2020-03-06 09:58:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Since we use pytest-django, it provides us the option --ds. It's like --settings from django tests so there is no need for additional actions"}, {'account_id': 28032, 'date': '2020-03-06 16:58:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 1736, 'date': '2020-03-09 17:44:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 28032, 'date': '2020-03-10 14:51:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 28032, 'date': '2020-03-10 17:40:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 28032, 'date': '2020-03-10 17:56:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 28032, 'date': '2020-03-11 10:25:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 28032, 'date': '2020-03-11 11:03:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 28032, 'date': '2020-03-11 11:14:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 12.'}, {'account_id': 28032, 'date': '2020-03-17 15:02:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 13.'}, {'account_id': 28032, 'date': '2020-03-17 15:51:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 14.'}, {'account_id': 28032, 'date': '2020-03-17 16:06:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 15.'}, {'account_id': 28032, 'date': '2020-03-18 13:42:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 16.'}, {'account_id': 28032, 'date': '2020-03-18 13:57:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 17.'}, {'account_id': 28032, 'date': '2020-03-19 09:24:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 18.'}, {'account_id': 28032, 'date': '2020-03-26 11:16:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 19.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2020-03-26 14:34:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 19: Code-Review-1

(19 comments)

I mentioned the general direction looks good in the horizon meeting yesterday, but there are a lot to be cleanup.'}, {'account_id': 28032, 'date': '2020-03-26 15:44:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 20.'}, {'account_id': 28032, 'date': '2020-03-26 16:06:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 20:

(12 comments)

Thanks Akihiro, good catch about random skips.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2020-03-26 16:17:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 19:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 28032, 'date': '2020-04-03 10:47:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 21.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2020-04-10 01:06:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 21: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 29313, 'date': '2020-04-13 06:09:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 21: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 1736, 'date': '2020-04-13 08:37:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 21:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 1736, 'date': '2020-04-13 11:02:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 21:

[{'created': '2020-03-04 10:21:00.000000000', 'message': "Change integration test runner to pytest

Changes test runner from django's unittest test runner to pytest with
pytest-django. This allows further use of this report in different CI
systems.

Change-Id: Idb6e63cd23ca2ba8ca56f36eb8b63069bd211944
"}, {'created': '2020-03-04 15:57:56.000000000', 'message': "Change horizon test runner to pytest

Changes test invocation from `manage.py test` to `pytest`. Adds addtitional
test requirements like pytest, pytest-django, pytest-html. Replaces
django's test `tag` to `pytest.mark`. Adds posibility to export test
results into xml and html formats

Change-Id: Idb6e63cd23ca2ba8ca56f36eb8b63069bd211944

commit_message:
Change horizon test runner to pytest

Changes test invocation from `manage.py test` to `pytest`. Adds addtitional
test requirements like pytest, pytest-django, pytest-html. Adds
`pytest.mark` alongside django's test `tag`. Adds posibility to export test
results into xml and html formats.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/712315/
Related-Bug: #1866666
Co-Authored-By: Ivan Kolodyazhny <e0ne@e0ne.info>
Change-Id: Idb6e63cd23ca2ba8ca56f36eb8b63069bd211944

adding overrides in their policy files that match the default but
stop the rule deprecation fallback from happening.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

commit_message:
Add new default roles in server password policies

This adds new defaults roles in server password API policies.
- Policies are made granular and default to System or project reader
for get and system admin or owner for clear policy.

Also add tests to simulates the future where we drop the deprecation
fall back in the policy by overriding the rules with a version where
there are no deprecated rule options. Operators can do the same by
adding overrides in their policy files that match the default but
stop the rule deprecation fallback from happening.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

Change-Id: I3571b73a3094f5f523ff7b655ca05355c65f90ff

I think we are missing api-ref docs for the extra parameters. Its good if they were included in this patch, I think:
https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/api-ref/source/os-flavor-extra-specs.inc'}, {'account_id': 782, 'date': '2020-04-06 12:43:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16:

(1 comment)

My -1 is for not updating the api-ref, AFAICT. If we lined up a follow up patch, I would be OK with that merging separatly, as I trust you pushing on that.

So I think, after we merge this, extra-specs is just like any other but of the API, microversions needed to evolve, bar the obvious pragmatic exceptions.

I acutally hate this validation mode stuff, my preferece would be to force a movement to CUSTOM_<key> for any key we don't support, similar to placement traits. While more complicated.

The reason why is the user listing flavor extra specs can't know if their admin is following the rules, or has done something that is not interoperable.

Now the validation will help the unspsecting admin with typos, but really the input validation should be to help interoperability. And this seems to halm it.

But clearly everyone else things this is a good idea, and the spec has merged, so I am not going to block it. But I don't think I can +2 this approach. It feels like it impacts negatively on the users I know about. Even though this is a step forward in understand what extra specs are supported, I think this "blesses" the custom approaches, without making it explicit in the API to users that their admin is doing something custom.'}, {'account_id': 782, 'date': '2020-04-06 12:47:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 7166, 'date': '2020-04-06 14:27:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 782, 'date': '2020-04-06 15:07:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16:

I like this proposal...

strict validation, only if the key starts with any known namespaces we use, such as:
* hw
* pci_passthrough

... we can discuss if we want to add a query param so you ensure the key is in a known namespace, but lets worry about that next cycle. The delete extra spec should not validate keys, we should allow any existing key to be deleted.

This means users listing extra specs will known which ones are offical or not.

While it would be nice to have all custom things in some custom: namespace, backwards compatibility would be messy.'}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2020-04-06 15:34:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16: -Code-Review

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2020-04-06 16:16:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 17.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2020-04-06 16:18:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16:

commit_message:
api: Add microversion for extra spec validation

Enable support for API-based extra spec validation. Since most of the
hard work has been done in previous patches, all that's necessary here
is to wire up the microversion handling and turn things on.

Part of blueprint flavor-extra-spec-validators

Change-Id: If67f0d924ea372746a6dc440ea7bdc655e4f0bea
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Cleanup doc support

Cleanup docs building:
- Remove obsolete sections from setup.cfg
- Switch to using sphinx-build
- Cleanup doc/source/conf.py to remove now obsolete content.
- Use newer openstackdocstheme version, use apidoc for
  API docs
- Fix doc problems found

Change-Id: I1f92444a145030e7715a8d357870d712c5d3cfb1

commit_message:
Add Octavia OVN Provider configuration

This patch supports configuring the OVN provider and sets up a pattern
that will later be expanded on to support multiple provider drivers
without requiring modification of the core Octavia configuration.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/714895/
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/705821/

Change-Id: If199f6e2841f8c7bbfe1fb56538b0283ac04681c
Related-Bug: #1861886
(cherry picked from commit d8a64956925feb007fbc1abbd03ff39d65470eb2)

commit_message:
Expose enable_isolated_aggregate_filtering parameter

Add support for configuring scheduler parameter option
`enable_isolated_aggregate_filtering` which allows the
scheduler to restrict hosts in aggregates based on matching
required traits in the aggregate metadata and the instance
flavor/image.

 Conflicts:
       manifests/scheduler.pp
       spec/classes/nova_scheduler_spec.rb

Resolved conflicts occured because of missing change
I6652b1321dd64f428fff2bc920f65e09e294ddfe

Change-Id: Iefb7e8a4d867b8721cdb5b00c2f71b2dd3a492c0
(cherry picked from commit 4b13841995f3dc0874aa1b830e5ce43b66415165)

commit_message:
Cleanup py27 support

This repo is now testing only with Python 3, so let's make
a few cleanups:
- Remove python 2.7 stanza from setup.py
- Add requires on python >= 3.6 to setup.cfg so that pypi and pip
  know about the requirement
- Remove obsolete sections from setup.cfg
- Update classifiers
- Update requirements, no need for python_version anymore
- Use newer openstackdocstheme and reno version
- Update hacking version to 3.0
- move python3 setting into toxenv, remove install_command and
  move constraints into deps

Change-Id: Ibb42f8199eb4ca93e438e5e7ef5d4c4e0b35a738

commit_message:
(follow-up) run check mode for more molecule tests

* Add check testing in _skeleton_role_ so all newly created roles will
  run check.

* Add check testing for the following roles:
  - tripleo_bootstrap
  - tripleo_clients_install
  - tripleo_config
  - tripleo_container_image_prepare

  - tripleo_ssh_known_hosts
  - tripleo_sshd
  - tripleo_systemd_wrapper

* Fix check mode for some roles.

Change-Id: I747de97a3ad4520e7fc9038f13c453421e86c057

subject: Authenticate before Authorization
messages: [{'account_id': 20312, 'date': '2020-04-01 10:14:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 1736, 'date': '2020-04-13 12:39:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2020-04-14 02:52:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-01 10:14:49.000000000', 'message': "Authenticate before Authorization

When user is not logged in and given Dashboard has some `permissions`
defined, `require_perms` decorator was raising `NotAuthorized('You are
not authorized to access %s')` instead of `NotAuthenticated('Please log
in to continue.')`.
This was caused by the order of decorating the views. The decorator
which is applied last is called first in the chain as it wraps the
decorators which were applied before.
This means that to check for authentication before checking permissions
we need to apply the `require_auth` decorator after `require_perms`.

Closes-Bug: 1869708
Change-Id: I94d3fa5c1472bb72c9111cab14c6e05180f88589
(cherry picked from commit e4fd69292c4a8340eba33f5c9d516796472e9269)
"}]
commit_message:
Authenticate before Authorization

When user is not logged in and given Dashboard has some `permissions`
defined, `require_perms` decorator was raising `NotAuthorized('You are
not authorized to access %s')` instead of `NotAuthenticated('Please log
in to continue.')`.
This was caused by the order of decorating the views. The decorator
which is applied last is called first in the chain as it wraps the
decorators which were applied before.
This means that to check for authentication before checking permissions
we need to apply the `require_auth` decorator after `require_perms`.

Closes-Bug: 1869708
Change-Id: I94d3fa5c1472bb72c9111cab14c6e05180f88589
(cherry picked from commit e4fd69292c4a8340eba33f5c9d516796472e9269)

commit_message:
Cleanup py27 support

This repo is now testing only with Python 3, so let's make
a few cleanups:
- Remove python 2.7 stanza from setup.py
- Remove obsolete sections from setup.cfg
- Update classifiers
- Switch from python2 only oslosphinx to openstackdocsthemem
- Remove install_command from tox.ini, the default is fine
- Switch to hacking 3.0 to support python 3

Change-Id: I37daff5a29f4732f4e3b2e20497903799d67caa3

commit_message:
[TRAIN-ONLY] Fix indentation

This fixes "'environment' is not a valid attribute for a
 IncludeRole" error in ipaservices-baremetal-ansible.yaml.

The above error was introduced because of a change in
indentation in the train backport:
https://review.opendev.org/#/c/718120/

Change-Id: I2c82d74b2f4f0531fe0c6ef724717aedd0e757d9

commit_message:
Fix docs build

Sphinx 3.0.1 complains with:

  horizon/horizon/base.py:docstring of horizon.Panel:33:duplicate object
  description of horizon.Panel.nav, other instance in contributor/ref/horizon,
  use :noindex: for one of them

Fix the two problem.

Change-Id: I98b6212c29dc66cc83a4c337771039796d939561

commit_message:
Cleanup py27 support

This repo is now testing only with Python 3, so let's make
a few cleanups:
- Remove python 2.7 stanza from setup.py
- Add requires on python >= 3.6 to setup.cfg so that pypi and pip
  know about the requirement
- Remove obsolete sections from setup.cfg
- Update classifiers
- Update requirements, no need for python_version anymore
- Switch to using sphinx-build
- Cleanup */source/conf.py to remove now obsolete content.
- Use newer openstackdocstheme version
- Use mock from unittest;leave it in test-requirements for now since
  otherwise lower-constraints fails since some repos expect mock to be
  installed without requiring it.
- Remove future imports, not needed for python3
- Update to newer hacking version for python3, disable one warning.
  Remove hacking requirements from lower-constraints, they are not
  needed there.
- Cleanup tox.ini, move basepython to top
- Update horizon requirement for ussuri

Change-Id: I1753bce3ac4fc4248783c0669cacab2e037e62fe

commit_message:
Remove invalid mistral envocation and references

This change removes the use of a mistral workflow from our deployment process
which assertains the ansible deployment status. This is being removed because
deployments are not longer executed via mistral so any data provided by mistral
would be wrong.

This change also removes the mistral workflow reference in our documentation
strings so it does not confuse folks maintaining the code.

Story: 2007212
Task: 38962
Task: 38961

Change-Id: I94fed2dd4968879d0ac3ea775dd498de20b78130
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>

The CollectorRegistry object does not allow an identical
metric to be added, which occasionally happens when the nova,
neutron and hypervisor collectors update their caches.

Also,
  - The cinder endpoint has been updated to v3 to resolve a 404
    which was occuring during metric collection.
  - Extra logging settings were removed from files. Log level and format
    are now set in main.py
  - misc pep8 fixes to imports and newlines

Change-Id: Ia0bebdc1a39b25bdeae47d01625cfb7b89d132eb
'}]
commit_message:
[fix] Openstack Exporter - Handle Duplicate Values

The CollectorRegistry object does not allow an identical
metric to be added, which occasionally happens when the nova,
neutron and hypervisor collectors update their caches.

Also,
  - The cinder endpoint has been updated to v3 to resolve a 404
    which was occuring during metric collection.
  - Extra logging settings were removed from files. Log level and format
    are now set in main.py
  - misc pep8 fixes to imports and newlines

Change-Id: Ia0bebdc1a39b25bdeae47d01625cfb7b89d132eb

commit_message:
Add Python3 victoria unit tests

This is an automatically generated patch to ensure unit testing
is in place for all the of the tested runtimes for victoria.

See also the PTI in governance [1].

[1]: https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/project-testing-interface.html

Change-Id: I2fa8505451caadbe895cc3262c0bf1470795968b

commit_message:
Remove redundant loading of file to read extra_vars

No need to read the file as ansible-runner natively supports[1] it.

[1] https://github.com/ansible/ansible-runner/blob/1.4.2/ansible_runner/runner_config.py#L400

Change-Id: Ieb75232b59e76b4e14cff3dfbd7eaa13422fdfaf

commit_message:
Add new parameter NovaSchedulerEnableIsolatedAggregateFiltering

Add new paramter NovaSchedulerEnableIsolatedAggregateFiltering
allows for configuring `scheduler/enable_isolated_aggregate_filtering`
parameter to restrict hosts in aggregates based on matching required
traits in the aggregate metadata and the instance flavor/image.

Also this fixes the typo in scheduler spelling in config_settings
section for placement_aggregate_required_for_tenants parameter.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/718326/
Change-Id: Ic6ef33d9c02be7e87c30626930f9e3d44cb77875

commit_message:
Add parameter to manage horizon's keystone_domain_choices

Since Stein release it is possible to set
OPENSTACK_KEYSTONE_DOMAIN_CHOICES using puppet-horizon
(change-id: I67c4c8923ef4d6e4c3420e0a2b0d38ee3c6e2819 ).

commit_message:
tripleo_bootstrap: do not fail if OVS rpm wasn't found

We have a use case where OVS rpm can be missing on very basic images,l
ike overcloud-minimal. This image can be used by downstream for e.g.
Ceph Storage nodes, where an OSP subscription wasn't used (OVS needs
OSP).

It was reported here: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1820306

This patch will look at eventual failures of the bootstrap packages
task, and stop the deployment only if OVS failed to be found, otherwise
the deployment will move on.

Change-Id: Ib8dcc48c15b04b810b1cde350d5138671469977e

The venv target was inheriting the default deps, which appropriately
just includes the main project requirements and our test requirements.
We also use venv for reno creation and other miscellaneous things, so it
is good to get all potential requirements installed. This adds the
installation of our docs requirements in the creation of the venv
environment.

'}]
commit_message:
Install all deps in venv creation

The venv target was inheriting the default deps, which appropriately
just includes the main project requirements and our test requirements.
We also use venv for reno creation and other miscellaneous things, so it
is good to get all potential requirements installed. This adds the
installation of our docs requirements in the creation of the venv
environment.

Change-Id: I8b232116e54e39243a009a195090f12ef1a56bd4
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Pass the actual target in os-aggregates policy

Currently if target is not passed in context.can(),
it use defauls target which is context.user_id, context.project_id.
These defaults target are not useful as it pass the
context's user_id and project_id only which means we tell
oslo policy to verify the context data with context data.

This commit pass the actual target for os-aggregates policies
which is empty dict because policy rule is system scoped rather
than project, so the token scope check deals with the required
target checking.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

Change-Id: Iacd5ba4ecdece12f04ace2a36a86ba46570c95ac

commit_message:
Blacklist stestr 3.0.0

It claims py2 support, but that's a lie.

Also, switch our tempest job to the py3 variant, now that glance (at
least) is py3-only and tempest-full is broken.

Change-Id: Ic30fe82ff72fe4d138ec4823d36f2a1cc56f1ac7
(cherry picked from commit 02e8f4f228c006927fe87f8a350c281b9cfccd98)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-12-21 20:21:11.000000000', 'message': "Resolve potential race condition when updating zone

When there are two or more changes in flight for a zone
it's possible that the first or second request
will finish before the other requests gets handled
by the worker. This will lead to the request failing
on the worker as an UPDATE request had already been handled.

The problem here is that while the UPDATE request
may have been handled, there is no way of knowing
if it was the first or second request that was
handled.

Change-Id: Ie9863dc1fbdbcc24c2baa73f8768c47985afcd09
"}, {'created': '2019-12-21 20:34:53.000000000', 'message': "Resolve potential race condition when updating zone

When there are two or more changes in flight for a zone
it's possible that the first request will finish before
the second requests gets handled.

The problem here is that while the UPDATE request
may have been handled, there is no way of knowing
if it was the second request that was handled
successfully.

This patch changes UPDATES on the worker to always
be honored. Worst case we will be updating the same

commit_message:
Resolve potential race condition when updating zone

When there are two or more changes in flight for a zone
it's possible that the first request will finish before
the second requests gets handled.

The problem here is that while the UPDATE request
may have been handled, there is no way of knowing
if it was the second request that was handled
successfully.

This patch changes UPDATES on the worker to always
be honored. Worst case we will be updating the same
same zone twice.

Partial-Bug: #1768618
Change-Id: Ie9863dc1fbdbcc24c2baa73f8768c47985afcd09

commit_message:
Add new default roles in os-aggregates policies

This adds new defaults roles in os-aggregates API policies. This policy
is default to system reader for GET and system admin role for all
other policies.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

Change-Id: I52edf46b11c888a98dfd2cd3d792767bef66dd90

commit_message:
Skip both tenant and management networks when generating certs

Without this change we were unable to deploy TLS Everywhere with
management network. This is because the service principal is not
created due to VIP being set to false in network_data.yaml

Closes-Bug: #1861097
Resolves: rhbz#1777605
Change-Id: I43fd5f67c1a0be6eaa1752575349e64329cada4a
(cherry picked from commit a22c04c576ce6956d4ca526b60b482501228f47e)

revisions:

Deprecate api_endpoint in nova::ironic::common because its actual
parameter, [ironic]api_endpioint, was already removed from nova
in Train release[1].
Also, add new nova::ironic::common::endpoint_override parameter to
allow operators to override endpoint to be used in acceess to ironic.

[1] I527f512b371705b490ba55dfab101340d417edb6
Change-Id: I838240f7138adcbf619ce12ac616f0bc517570dd
(cherry picked from commit c2e40bceab81eccbb2012caf5d8c75077724c5b4)
'}]
commit_message:
Replace removed ironic api_endpoint by endpoint_override

Deprecate api_endpoint in nova::ironic::common because its actual
parameter, [ironic]api_endpioint, was already removed from nova
in Train release[1].
Also, add new nova::ironic::common::endpoint_override parameter to
allow operators to override endpoint to be used in acceess to ironic.

[1] I527f512b371705b490ba55dfab101340d417edb6
Change-Id: I838240f7138adcbf619ce12ac616f0bc517570dd
(cherry picked from commit c2e40bceab81eccbb2012caf5d8c75077724c5b4)

(1 comment)

See comment inline.  The recent policy change [0] allows unsupported drivers to remain in-tree at the discretion of the Cinder team.  You are making good-faith efforts to get your third-party CI running, so I am in favor of adding you driver back right now as 'unsupported', and we can mark it 'supported' in a follow-up patch.  The driver support status for a release is set at RC-1 time, so that gives you a few weeks to get this sorted out (though of course, I recommend getting the CI fixed as soon as possible!).

So what I'm saying is, make the change I suggest, and then I'm +2 on this patch.

[0] https://docs.openstack.org/cinder/latest/drivers-all-about.html#driver-removal"}, {'account_id': 21884, 'date': '2020-03-27 18:11:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

The revert itself looks good.  It passed Nimble CI on PS3, in which the only difference is that the current PS marks the driver as unsupported.  Since the Nimble team is working on the CI, and the driver has passed tempest and cinder-tempest-plugin tests on py3.7, I'm OK with reinstating the driver as unsupported now, and then marking it as supported in a follow-up patch once the CI has stabilized."}, {'account_id': 24921, 'date': '2020-03-29 16:11:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Can we please have a new release note added with this patch explaining that the driver is being restored but that the still needs the 'enable_unsupported_driver=True' set.  That can obviously be then updated as no longer being necessary when we remove the unsupported tag."}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2020-03-30 19:54:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: Code-Review+1

(4 comments)

Jay has a good point.  See inline for suggested release note text.

Once the CI is reliable, you can submit a patch that:
- marks the driver supported
- deletes the release note you're adding on this patch
- adds a release note saying that the driver is restored to 'supported' status

I know you're working hard on the CI, but this way we're covered if something goes sideways.  (I think it's better to get this patch merged, and then everything else becomes a quick follow-up instead of a major review.)"}, {'account_id': 15831, 'date': '2020-03-30 21:07:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(2 comments)

Sorry I wasn't clear about the release note files.  Here's the deal.  (But before I explain, don't forget to fix the whitespace problem noted inline.)

(1) releasenotes/notes/nimble-mark-usnsupported-0c8e5e21c8d1179d.yaml is the release note from Train; you should not delete it.  When the release notes are generated, it will show up in the Train part, not Ussuri.  So do *not* delete it as part of this patch.

(2) releasenotes/notes/nimble-driver-removal-ff80d077e7707614.yaml is part of the change you are reverting that happened earlier in the Ussuri development cycle, so deleting it is correct.

(3) releasenotes/notes/nimble-mark-unsupported-0c8e5e21c8d2179d.yaml is the new note you are adding on this patch.  We need it here because if you don't get the CI running in Ussuri, operators need to know that the driver is still here and that they need to do the config file change to get it to run.

OK, so what will happen is that if you do get the CI stabilized (as I hope you will!), you can submit a patch to make your driver 'supported' in Ussuri.  That patch will contain a release note saying that the Nimble driver is now fully supported.  If that patch happens in Ussuri (it must be merged before RC-1, which will be released the week of April 20), then it can also remove (3) above, because that will no longer be relevant.  But if the support patch happens later, (3) will stay as part of Ussuri and your driver will become supported in Victoria.

I hope that's clear -- ping me in irc if you have any questions (i am in the new york time zone).  I'd like you to get this merged and out of the way so you can concentrate on getting your CI stabilized!"}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2020-03-31 14:13:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

OK, we discussed this in the #openstack-cinder channel.

Please go back to PS6, that was fine.'}, {'account_id': 18883, 'date': '2020-03-31 14:27:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

Change-Id: I8310c2485f2bfb9b283068d43c8acd35f29197c3

commit_message:
Allow ceph metal CI deployments

eth1 interface is not a valid interface for metal deployments.
br-mgmt interface should be used instead as a `monitor_interface`.

Change-Id: I8310c2485f2bfb9b283068d43c8acd35f29197c3
(cherry picked from commit 18a35faea121096b0f779929e689fa79ef4328b1)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-08 20:45:20.000000000', 'message': 'Pass --all-stores, --allow-failure as bool to API

Newly added command line options --all-stores, --allow-failure are boolean
but we are passing it as a string to glance API. This will cause problem if
those parameters are not converted to boolean at API side.

Passing these parameters as boolean instead of string to API.

Change-Id: I8d4eab9241fc9bb24bc40b47bf18d63c86a97d77
Closes-Bug: #1871674
(cherry picked from commit dff5c881bdbc7f0cf03d88e974ae4234cb646aa1)
'}]
commit_message:
Pass --all-stores, --allow-failure as bool to API

Newly added command line options --all-stores, --allow-failure are boolean
but we are passing it as a string to glance API. This will cause problem if
those parameters are not converted to boolean at API side.

Passing these parameters as boolean instead of string to API.

Change-Id: I8d4eab9241fc9bb24bc40b47bf18d63c86a97d77
Closes-Bug: #1871674
(cherry picked from commit dff5c881bdbc7f0cf03d88e974ae4234cb646aa1)

commit_message:
Drop unicode() hacking check

This hacking check is no longer required now that we have moved to py3.
There probably isn't much need to use unicode() calls, but if the
situation calls for it, it is now better to do that than to direct
people to use six methods.

Some minor cleanup of hacking config included.

Change-Id: I5c97e673223d29b18aad37804d0d7b8c07e501c2
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

https://review.opendev.org/#/c/649267/

wsmeext.sphinxext fail.

we can unblock it.

Change-Id: I81a11e1f3a32344feacb5031287197b3f8386f59

commit_message:
Block Sphinx 3.0.1 for now

The sphinx wsmeext extension does not work in its current version with
Sphinx 3, it fails with:
Could not import extension wsmeext.sphinxext (exception: cannot import name 'l_')

This was already fixed in:
https://review.opendev.org/#/c/649267/

But there's no release of wsme yet and thus projects using
wsmeext.sphinxext fail.

Unblock these repos with blocking Sphinx 3.0.1. Once wsme is released,
we can unblock it.

Change-Id: I81a11e1f3a32344feacb5031287197b3f8386f59

commit_message:
Include uc plan var when TripleoInventories contains a single plan

I2cc721676005536b14995980f7a042991c92adcc switched to using TripleoInventories
for both single and multi stack inventories. However the 'plan' undercloud var
was no longer set.
Restore this for single stack inventories only to keep compatibility.

Change-Id: I5735cfaa5fe59eabde66b3370a2c5838ff0c4b23
Related-bug: #1849073
(cherry picked from commit 2afb9771f0532335e971c72c0eb206de2fc38886)

commit_message:
Use absolute name to include puppet classes

Current puppet modules uses only absolute name to include classes,
so replace relative name by absolute name in template files so that
template description can be consistent with puppet implementation.

Change-Id: I7a704d113289d61ed05f7a31d65caf2908a7994a

commit_message:
[train-only] Duplicate inventory filters in tripleo-upgrade

Break the circular dependency where tripleo-upgrade depends on tripleo-ansible
but tripleo-upgrade is used to update tripleo-ansible.

commit_message:
Update master for stable/ussuri

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/ussuri.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/ussuri.

Change-Id: I75dc03a9d29c65b8d104b8d3a95915094cba6320
Sem-Ver: feature

Remove unit test jobs with latest puppet

We don't have unit tests with latest puppet in stable/stein, so it
doesn't make sense to have it in older branches.

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 6926, 'name': 'Bogdan Dobrelya', 'email': 'bdobreli@redhat.com', 'username': 'bogdando'}, {'_account_id': 7144, 'name': 'James Slagle', 'email': 'jslagle@redhat.com', 'username': 'slagle'}, {'_account_id': 7353, 'name': 'Kevin Carter', 'email': 'kevin@cloudnull.com', 'username': 'cloudnull'}, {'_account_id': 8833, 'name': 'Rabi Mishra', 'email': 'ramishra@redhat.com', 'username': 'rabi'}, {'_account_id': 20778, 'name': 'Damien Ciabrini', 'email': 'dciabrin@redhat.com', 'username': 'dciabrin'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 25877, 'name': 'Luke Short', 'email': 'ekultails@gmail.com', 'username': 'ekultails'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 25877, 'date': '2019-12-06 16:49:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 25877, 'date': '2019-12-09 19:18:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2019-12-10 19:35:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 25877, 'date': '2019-12-11 20:26:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 25877, 'date': '2019-12-11 20:28:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2019-12-12 05:12:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

Not sure if this would help in any way with the current issues.

I think the issue is with the retry logic in container-puppet.py[1] as evident from https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1779165#c16. We only try to delete the container and associate storage when it succeeds. IMO, we should try to delete the container and storage for failure too, as podman run is atomic and storage is not cleaned up for failure.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/blob/master/common/container-puppet.py#L329'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2019-12-12 11:52:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I meant as podman run is __not__ atomic. I've a patch (no tested) to try delete containers before retry, if you want to test.
https://review.opendev.org/#/c/698622/"}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2019-12-12 19:14:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 25877, 'date': '2019-12-12 20:09:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 25877, 'date': '2019-12-12 20:10:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2019-12-12 20:20:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 25877, 'date': '2019-12-12 20:24:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 25877, 'date': '2019-12-12 20:25:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2019-12-12 20:26:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

lgtm so far'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2019-12-16 06:01:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

I still don't understand what we're doing here.

Have we seen 'podman rm  -f' fail the first time and succeed in the subsequent attempts?"}, {'account_id': 25877, 'date': '2019-12-17 16:23:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Based on what we have seen, sometimes container resources are reported as being "busy" so the container rm fails. When encountering such errors, I have manually logged into the affected Overcloud node(s) and ran `podman rm` without a problem. In theory, this should help with those scenarios.'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2020-01-02 08:58:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2

Given the latest comment, the proposed retrying makes sense'}, {'account_id': 25877, 'date': '2020-01-02 18:45:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 25877, 'date': '2020-01-02 18:51:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 25877, 'date': '2020-01-02 22:32:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: Workflow-1

The tripleo-ci-centos-7-scenario004-standalone job is failing with this patch. A RunTime exception keeps getting thrown making the retries kick in. That shouldn't be happening since if we detect that the container exists, it should just default to `return None` and then move on. http://paste.openstack.org/show/788019/"}, {'account_id': 25877, 'date': '2020-01-02 22:54:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 25877, 'date': '2020-01-03 16:08:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 25877, 'date': '2020-01-03 20:20:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

Based on the CI reports, I do not believe that the Depends-On patch mentioned is being pulled in for tripleo-common. The same error message is occurring when it should no longer exist in the code: https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/7ae577f54205412cb44e74c2e7663065/log/logs/undercloud/home/zuul/standalone_deploy.log.txt.gz'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2020-01-03 20:48:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2020-01-07 07:55:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

that's weird. Let's merge teh dependency first then"}, {'account_id': 7144, 'date': '2020-01-07 18:22:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9: Code-Review-1

I don't see how the Depends-On is related, or how it would fix the error that you're seeing in CI. Can you add some more context?"}, {'account_id': 25877, 'date': '2020-01-07 18:52:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

We want the container deletion to be retried. This patch here adds that functionality to Paunch. We also want that used in other parts of the code so I submitted a patch for the tripleo-common scripts/container-update.py to be able to utilize our retries. We can see from the CI failure that the error message that container-puppet.py originally had is still being logged (something that should no longer happen if it was properly using Paunch for the deletion of the container): https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/7ae577f54205412cb44e74c2e7663065/log/logs/undercloud/home/zuul/standalone_deploy.log.txt.gz#8236 The Depends-On is less of a dependency and more of a patch ordering to help address the main CI failure.'}, {'account_id': 25877, 'date': '2020-01-07 18:55:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

To summarize: We want to apply the retry for container deletion everywhere we can.'}, {'account_id': 25877, 'date': '2020-01-14 17:46:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

I believe I was misinterpreting the CI failure I encountered to be in container-update.py when it was actually container-puppet.py. I have tested having only this patch applied to Paunch and it does fix the problem for container-puppet.py. I will update the commit message and remove the dependency.'}, {'account_id': 25877, 'date': '2020-01-14 17:49:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2020-01-15 11:02:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2020-01-15 11:10:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 25877, 'date': '2020-01-15 14:32:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10:

It's still failing CI (with a real error) but now on the 'Run puppet host configuration for step 1' task: https://storage.gra.cloud.ovh.net/v1/AUTH_dcaab5e32b234d56b626f72581e3644c/zuul_opendev_logs_91b/697696/10/check/tripleo-ci-centos-7-scenario007-multinode-oooq-container/91b171a/logs/undercloud/home/zuul/overcloud_deploy.log.txt.gz"}, {'account_id': 25877, 'date': '2020-01-15 14:32:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 25877, 'date': '2020-02-07 20:14:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 25877, 'date': '2020-02-14 20:17:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 25877, 'date': '2020-02-17 04:19:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 12.'}, {'account_id': 25877, 'date': '2020-02-17 15:00:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 12:

It looks like executing the command to delete a container is itself returning a RunTime error (not Paunch's remove_container method) resulting in the tenacity to iterate until the method fails: https://logserver.rdoproject.org/96/697696/12/openstack-check/tripleo-ci-centos-7-ovb-1ctlr_1comp-featureset001/46f52fd/logs/undercloud/home/zuul/overcloud_deploy.log.txt.gz"}, {'account_id': 25877, 'date': '2020-02-18 19:02:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 13.'}, {'account_id': 25877, 'date': '2020-02-19 15:17:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 14.'}, {'account_id': 25877, 'date': '2020-04-13 18:48:40.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

This patch introduces more problems than it solves.'}]

commit_message:
Retry removing containers.

If a container cannot be removed succesfully the first time,
Paunch will now try again two more times by default (three total).
If a container already exists, it will also not error out.

Change-Id: I237800ea09a5b20f71db83b4c41a425be2af007b
Closes-Bug: #1859650
Signed-off-by: Luke Short <ekultails@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Update master for stable/ussuri

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/ussuri.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/ussuri.

Change-Id: Ib356624acdf10e24f42da957d2f8a7216cfbab3f
Sem-Ver: feature

[{'created': '2020-04-11 18:49:32.000000000', 'message': 'Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/ussuri

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/ussuri branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ieddb6795cfb32926e9222ce8f11231206eae1357
'}]
commit_message:
Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/ussuri

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/ussuri branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ieddb6795cfb32926e9222ce8f11231206eae1357

[{'created': '2020-04-11 00:17:23.000000000', 'message': 'Improve `list --versions` output

Have `--versions` imply `--long` and add a new column for version_id.

Also, have version-aware listings show all versions as "null" on old
Swifts that don't support object versioning (or when object versioning
is not enabled).

Change-Id: I0e009bce2471d1c140ac9b83700591cb355fee3f
'}]
commit_message:
Improve `list --versions` output

Have `--versions` imply `--long` and add a new column for version_id.

Also, have version-aware listings show all versions as "null" on old
Swifts that don't support object versioning (or when object versioning
is not enabled).

Change-Id: I0e009bce2471d1c140ac9b83700591cb355fee3f

documentation has two references to the same driver interface and
it caused a problem while generating docs, since none of them was
tagged with ``:noindex:``.

Closes-Bug: #1872479

commit_message:
Fix docs duplicated autoclass definition

Fixed an issue in the contributor reference. The share replicas
documentation has two references to the same driver interface and
it caused a problem while generating docs, since none of them was
tagged with ``:noindex:``.

Change-Id: I9db0f2c07a8178895490fbcab9bfd9dcd2ccf823
Closes-Bug: #1872479

commit_message:
WIP: Preload and dump configurable variables

Provide a configuration file (`~/.swiftcli/config`) to enforce variables as default for Swift client.

Dump default variables

$ swift download --config-dump
container-threads=10
object-threads=10
skip-identical=False
no-download=False
no-shuffle=True

Create a config file to enforce some variables as default

$ cat ~/.swiftcli/config
[download]
container-threads=10
object-threads=20
skip-identical=False
no-download=False
no-shuffle=False

$ swift download --config-dump
container-threads=10
object-threads=20
skip-identical=False
no-download=False
no-shuffle=False

Change-Id: Iba82de332474ebfc86c36088afd099f7f6681c0e
Closes-Bug: #1862890

commit_message:
Cleanup py27 support

Make a few cleanups:
- Remove python 2.7 stanza from setup.py
- Remove obsolete sections from setup.cfg
- Update requirements, no need for python_version anymore
- Cleanup doc/source/conf.py to remove now obsolete content.
- Use newer openstackdocstheme version
- Cleanup tox.ini for Python 3 only

Change-Id: I9d63e63cf142fded002f7212588266d88f41dd06

commit_message:
Blacklist stestr 3.0.0

It claims py2 support, but that's a lie.

Also, switch our tempest job to the py3 variant, now that glance (at
least) is py3-only and tempest-full is broken.

Change-Id: Ic30fe82ff72fe4d138ec4823d36f2a1cc56f1ac7

commit_message:
Create new Ceph job with c-bak service enabled

Currently backup service is disable in Ceph jobs.
In order to solve this cinder-tempest-plugin-cbak-ceph is
defined with the c-bak service enabled.

As a matter of fact the c-bak is redundant incase of lvm job
because the parent job already has enabled the service.

In addition, Tempest provides a blacklist file so that only
storage-relevant tests are executed. Use it instead of the
custom blacklist, which is removed in this patch.

This means that some tests which were previously skipped are
now executed.

If backup tests don't work with the LVM backend, they can be
disabled through the volume_feature_enabled.backup configuration
key.

Co-authored-by: Luigi Toscano <ltoscano@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Id809c37704d4ee741df4333ca01ddd4ec22f33b5

commit_message:
Fix deletion of network quotas

Network quotas could be deleted after deletion of project. This
caused the cleanup to fail as network quotas have to be deleted
before the deletion of project.

This fix makes sure that network quotas are deleted before the
deletion of project.

Change-Id: I8576e2c6f1ae6dc90850dd3d8eade7c10942e413

commit_message:
Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/ussuri

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/ussuri branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ifa9e92e45018b21506011215b28580ee01bb4048

commit_message:
Remove pod_ip_caching from _kuryr_k8s_opts

This option has been removed from drivers.utils in [1] so it fails when
trying to build config file with oslo-config-generator.

This patch is just removing that config opts from the list of kuryr-k8s
config opts.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/718389/

Change-Id: Ib579bc4c2338a3880bfe58a3d5bdbc1163ed8c7e

commit_message:
Cleanup py27 support

Make a few cleanups:
- Remove obsolete sections from setup.cfg
- Switch to using sphinx-build
- Cleanup doc/source/conf.py to remove now obsolete content.
- Use newer openstackdocstheme version
- Remove install_command from tox.ini, the default is fine;
  cleanup for Python 3 only
- Fix sphinx warnings

Change-Id: Ic70971b3c927508cd8a69b74f0c6b152671e8f83

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-09 21:17:32.000000000', 'message': 'molecule/podman_*: enable check mode testing

Replace verify (not used) by check; which will run the converge playbook
in check mode, and therefore increase testing coverage.

Check mode is often used by operators who want to do dry runs of the
playbooks before its actual execution.

Change-Id: Ia940552110cdbdae58bd09b2c422138d0c251614
'}, {'created': '2020-04-13 13:50:44.000000000', 'message': 'molecule/podman_*: enable check mode testing

Replace verify (not used) by check; which will run the converge playbook
in check mode, and therefore increase testing coverage.

Check mode is often used by operators who want to do dry runs of the
playbooks before its actual execution.

Change-Id: Ia940552110cdbdae58bd09b2c422138d0c251614
'}]
commit_message:
molecule/podman_*: enable check mode testing

Replace verify (not used) by check; which will run the converge playbook
in check mode, and therefore increase testing coverage.

Check mode is often used by operators who want to do dry runs of the
playbooks before its actual execution.

Change-Id: Ia940552110cdbdae58bd09b2c422138d0c251614

commit_message:
Repair the topology interface in api doc

The response of /v1/topology  should be tree structure and  an inclusive relationship.
In this document it is actually a graph structure, but the graph_type parameter is tree.
In our vitrage , the tree type and graph type is both  very important ,I think it is better
 to write an example for both interfaces.

Change-Id: I0dc100f1c6c49615b82613551477c3851f0836e8
