subject: Add PTL Guide to policies
messages:
[{'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2020-03-06 23:41:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2020-03-06 23:42:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

First draft. I need to take another look at this Monday, but if my laptop crashes over the weekend I wanted it to exist somewhere else too. :-)'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2020-03-19 22:45:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2020-03-19 22:47:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Okay, I think this is ready for review now. I won't promise it covers absolutely every part of PTLing Oslo, but I think everything in my private notes and a fair bit more is included."}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2020-03-24 13:10:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

Looks good.

What do you think about put some comments about "mailing list" rules and policy in our scope (if exist). Example tags `[oslo]` and how to communicate in specific situation.'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2020-03-25 21:05:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> Looks good.
 > 
 > What do you think about put some comments about "mailing list"
 > rules and policy in our scope (if exist). Example tags `[oslo]` and
 > how to communicate in specific situation.

What sort of things are you thinking of? We have https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Oslo which has information about contacting the team (although I note that the mailing list section is currently wrong - it points at openstack-dev and doesn't mention the [oslo] tag - now fixed).

Are you thinking we should suggest the PTL subscribe to the tag? My own policy on that is actually that I don't filter the mailing list because there can be discussions in any project that involve Oslo, but I realize not everyone will be a fan of that.'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2020-03-26 11:34:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> > Looks good.
 > >
 > > What do you think about put some comments about "mailing list"
 > > rules and policy in our scope (if exist). Example tags `[oslo]`
 > and
 > > how to communicate in specific situation.
 > 
 > What sort of things are you thinking of? We have https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Oslo
 > which has information about contacting the team (although I note
 > that the mailing list section is currently wrong - it points at
 > openstack-dev and doesn't mention the [oslo] tag - now fixed).

My concern was to know if specific things exist for PTL regarding the mailing list, but apparently not, and also enough infos are available on oslo's wiki, the goal of my comment was only to heads up this part (the ML topic), so if you fixed related things then I think it's enough and that I reached my goal :)

 > 
 > Are you thinking we should suggest the PTL subscribe to the tag? My
 > own policy on that is actually that I don't filter the mailing list
 > because there can be discussions in any project that involve Oslo,
 > but I realize not everyone will be a fan of that.

No, I think it's a good thing to take a look outside oslo too.

Thanks for your feedback.'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2020-03-26 16:20:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Yeah, there isn't much PTL-specific that I do in regards to the mailing list. I probably send more to the list than I used to in order to keep everyone up to date on what's going on, but even if we wanted to document that as a best practice it probably belongs in the cross-project PTL guide, not the Oslo one. In fact, there is some discussion of the mailing list there already: https://docs.openstack.org/project-team-guide/ptl.html#collecting-feedback

So good suggestion, but I think it's covered already."}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-03-30 20:58:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

(3 comments)

Great start! Thanks for putting this together Ben.'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2020-03-30 22:34:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

(3 comments)

I'll push a followup for Sean's comments."}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2020-04-13 15:30:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Workflow+1

I don't see any dissension on the content of this, and it's a living document so if anyone has any proposed changes they can be done as followups."}]

commit_message:
Add PTL Guide to policies

Since Oslo is composed of a large number of repos, this seems like
the most sensible place to document our project-specific PTL details.
I expect this to be a living document that evolves as new PTLs come
up with new best practices and tips.

Change-Id: Idea654584a7f45e6567f066b2f7a3df27c51f65b

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-12 04:07:43.000000000', 'message': 'doc: Fix term mismatch warnings in glossary

The term role has became case sensitive since sphinx 3.0.1.
It causes the following warnings and makes a check job fail.

  WARNING: term not in glossary: availability zone

This patch fixes the issue.

Change-Id: I1f993b503ef769da0950afa206d6ac4a54f903b4
Closes-Bug: #1872260
'}]
commit_message:
doc: Fix term mismatch warnings in glossary

The term role has became case sensitive since sphinx 3.0.1.
It causes the following warnings and makes a check job fail.

  WARNING: term not in glossary: availability zone

This patch fixes the issue.

Change-Id: I1f993b503ef769da0950afa206d6ac4a54f903b4
Closes-Bug: #1872260
